text: This placed is owned by monta so it is really damn good. I prefer this over monta because it's not as rich as the monta broth that hurts my stomach after I'm done, also monta is always packed from start to finish and is in the middle of chinatown. My only problem with this place is that its more expensive then monta. Montas ramen is about 6 or 7 dollars, this place charges 9 dollars for ramen and that's not including your extras. But it's right down the street from my job so I can't complain too much. Also you can choose your spicy level. All in all I definitely will be coming here like once a week.

This place is amazing! The staff are very friendly and the service is quick. They make the ramen noodles fresh and in-house  you choose from several choices of broths that come with standard fillings. From there, you can add many different "sides" to customize your bowl. It's well-priced and the food is absolutely delicious. My two-year-old even loved it! The only potential downfall is it's very small so big parties would be hard to accommodate, and I can see the wait would be really long in peak hours. So, my advice is to go early if you don't want to wait too long. I highly recommend Ramen Kobo!

Visiting Las Vegas with family. We had 4 adults and 5 kids (ages 3 to 11). I'm  from California and had traditional Japanese ramen. This is not traditional but I don't  think this was their intention. They make their noodles in house. The noodles taste good but is again not traditional ramen noodle..it is starchy. If anyone has tried Korean Chinese food, the noodles most resembles that. 

One can choose from a variety of broth and they come with a little bit of toppings. I wouldn't suggest adding extras unless you want an egg. I like spicy so I had spicy miso (medium spicyness). It was good and tasted like jampong. I ordered miso broth for my kids. This is where they miss the mark. Because the noodles were starchy,  their soup became thick and starchy. This least resembles Japnese ramen broth which is light in texture and flavorful. 

I also ordered a small wgg roe rice (see pic) which I enjoyed but also not traditionally Japanese. The egg roe they use is is a Korean egg roe which is salty. I still liked it. The rice with pork was a good optiom for kids.

The place is small. They had to split us.

Dinner on opening day, Shoyu ramen times two. The first shoyu ramen ordered the original way and the second, due to dietary restrictions, side pork items only with soft boiled egg and veggie broth instead. Tasted great, but restaurant could not substitute pork for chicken for me and would charge to do so. I wasn't trying to obtain something for free but thought it would have been a compromise at least with a piece of chicken and still charge me $2.50 even if I declined the pork items ?! That did not sit well
with me. This restaurant is similar to Monta entree availability. It's okay but maybe they should be more flexible w orders or have a build your own soup / noodle bowl.
This place is amazing! The ramen and fried rice are on point. Probably the best bowl of ramen I've ever had. Prices are extremely fair considering the quality of food you're getting

If I could give 0 stars, I would. Normally I don't care to write a review even though I'm quite the noodle aficionado, but I was certainly compelled to as I was quite disappointed to find out your restaurant was closed when I made it a point to take time out of my day and to drive over to your location specifically to try you folks out at 3pm - just to find out you were closed. You most certainly should post your hours on Yelp so other reviewers are aware of your gap in hours, closing at 2:30pm just to reopen at 5pm. Or post it on the web since everyone has access to the Internet nowadays and that info would have been most helpful. Even though you have Monta Ramen and Monta Chaya under your belt, I would rethink the financial strength of this new business venture and the ingredients compromised if saving 2.5 hours out of your day helps your bottom line NOI. And hopefully I won't see this facility show up on Dirty Dining as well like Monta in the past. And so considering you are promoting the grand opening of your restaurant, this is certainly a easy way to lose business and to lose a client like myself.

First time eating ramen and it was the best place to go! The staff was super friendly and welcoming. We waited about 5 minutes to be seated but that's nothing for a Saturday at lunch hour. I probably wouldn't recommend going with more than 2 people because it's really small. Soooo happy they had vegan ramen. It was so good, I already want to go back. The prices are really good, too. Super cheap and they give you a very large portion. Super satisfied. I'll be going back again soon :)

Small and amazing ramen shop! I sat at the bar and ordered the Miso ramen with chashu pork and it was everything my heart desired. The staff was friendly and the service was fast. I haven't had this good a ramen house experience since I lived in San Francisco.
Love this place. It is so close to my house. I really enjoyed with my kids. We loved home made noodle and soup. Very reasonable  price. Definitely will go back.

I had the Tonkonsu Ramen Mild Spicy, added egg, flying fish roe and black garlic oil. The Ramen and the soup taste really good. It's my first time there and I love it. Service is great. Will definitely go back next time.
Got my order to go it was still hot when I got back to my office and it was delicious. I might have to go hotter on the spice next time I played it safe. I will return for another bowl.

First let me say how glad I am that a ramen joint opened up on this side of town, we've been sorely needing one! From the sound of it, this is owned by the same people as Monta and that's definitely a good thing.

Anyway, the service was great and everyone was very friendly. The menu, while small, is still good as they at least offer fried rice in place of more traditional appetizers. Usually ramen fills me up so I don't always go for appetizers anyway so its not a big deal to me. That said, I think it would be greatly appreciated if they expanded their menu a bit. Not going to knock it for lack of gyoza.

The food was great! I got the shoyu ramen as I like lighter ramen in the summer months and it really hits the spot. Very similar to Monta's style of ramen. And you can even see the noodle machine working. Freshly made noodles are always a good sign.

Not sure why so many people are complaining about the size of this place, its an average sized ramen shop, why would you bring a large party? All the decent shops in Chinatown are similar size as well.

I'm a fan and I'll definitely be coming back!
Spicy Ramen lover heaven. Flavorful and they let you choose your level spice. One of the cleanest and tidiest ramen I've seen; big plus

I stayed at a friend's place with a bunch of other friends for our weekend trip in Vegas, and our friend recommended this place.

The menu is very simple and straightforward so nothing confusing on there! I ordered the Tonkotsu broth (came with black mushrooms, chives, bean sprouts, ground beef, pork shashu and bamboo shoots but I omitted the bamboo) with Hot spice level.

We didn't have to wait too long for our food, maybe 15 minutes before it came out. The broth was quite creamy, and since I enjoy spicy, the Hot level had a nice kick but not anything crazy for me. My favorite part were the noodles! They were nice and thin, and I could tell they were handmade.

Overall I really enjoyed the ramen here. It wasn't amazing, but it was good to the point where I would recommend it to others if you're craving ramen in the Vegas area!

Their food was too over priced. And the soup was very oily. Also you can't substitute the toppings that come with the soup even if you don't want some of them, you have to pay an additional cost for the toppings you want.

The flavor is very good. Medium spicy is very spicy in my opinion.  The noodles and fillings were delicious. The only disappointment is the broth. It was so oily that I didn't want to drink the broth. I wanted to love it. If the oil can be toned down in the broth it would be perfect.
Awesome little place! Great ramen if you don't wanna hull all the way over to spring mountain.

The good : porkbelly rice was really good. Service was fast and friendly. Noodles were fresh

The Bad : Tonkotsu Ramen didn't have any pork broth flavor. You also had to pay extra to add nori and an egg to your order.

If you love Monta, you will love this one too!!
Even better because they can make the soup as hot/spicy as you want.
The friend rice is exactly the same. Delicious !!
The location is great, right by 215 and Durango.
The place is way nicer than Monta.

The restaurant is always busy so my husband and I have always called in our order for take out. It's always ready on time and packed nicely - noodles in one container and broth in another. The sides are also packed nicely in separate containers.

As you can expect, ramen comes out quick! Staff super attentative and friendly. But about the ramen...

I had the hot miso ramen. It is excellent. The noodles are fresh made and have a viewing window to watch them. Fresh is key! 

The fried rice comes in two size portjons which os great. Nothing to not like in taste. 

The food was really good my only wish is that the menu gets bigger because it was so good. But we came for ramen so maybe asking too much.
broth is not too salty, just right! i was not a big fan of ramen but this place changed me! i crave this once a week :)

I've been to 3 or 4 ramen restaurants in Vegas and nothing compares to Kobo. My go-to is Miso sometimes mild sometimes medium. For the bigger appetites you can add extra noodle for a small fee (recommended). Very well priced. Lots of extras and add-ins to make it perfect for your tastes. Staff is as friendly as can be. Just go and thank me later.

Best ramen in town. I think they are even better than monta ramen! Their pork belly bowl is to die for and also nice touch to have the spicy level. Customer service was great as well! Our server taiwon was very nice and professional! Keep up the great work guys!!! Will be back for sure
I give only 3 stars because the broth is extra fatty and the broth is very bland. Have to pay extra to add Pork to your ramen. Otherwise, place is small, service was good and fast.

Just walked out of this "four-star" ramen place with my friend and are we glad we have a place to vent and will explain why here: First, the broth was okay. Noodle (whatever and however you have going on behind the window near the entrance) was nothing special. Servants are very polite to some degree some might get annoyed and call them fake. Funny to see the cooks were Hispanics and tried to greet customers in Japanese with a heavy accent (this does not factor into our rating). Hear this: our ramen soups had no eggs and only one thin piece of pork. Are you kidding us!? This is America where we are not as tiny as some of you and we don't pay adult prices to be served tiny kids meals!!! They served just about everything from chashu pork, fried garlic, black mushrooms, chives, ground pork, bamboo shoots, sesame oil, and shredded red pepper ultra small so you don't get enough and have to  pay more (close to $20 per bowl) to get more. Maybe we should be as STINGY as them but one star is the CHEAPEST I can give so there you have it. We don't see the value here at all. In fact, not even close. We have paid less and received a lot more (four ultra-thick porks and realistically maybe 20 times more than here) before. If you want the name of that restaurant, contact us and we'll gladly inform you which one it is). This restaurant is just way too STINGY and we will NO DOUBT NEVER BE BACK! Moving forward, we better turn off our phones now to save power (and money) as the lesson I learned eating at such a STINGY dining establishment. Actually, to be honest, this got to be one of the cheapest restaurants we have ever experienced.

Love that there is a decent ramen place close to home. They have four levels of spicy or you can just got original like I do which is no spice. This last visit I went for miso broth (pork and chicken) and I also added an egg and corn. My noodles were a little under cooked on top so I just mixed them to the bottom and that finished them off. They were fairly busy so I think that's why the noodles were ready all the way through but it wasn't really a problem. Service was good when we sat but we did have to wait a while for the check even with our dishes having been cleared already.  Overall a good place for ramen on the southwest side of town.

Before this I used to go to Monta Ramen when visiting family in LV.

The only type of ramen I eat is Tonkotsu broth based. This place now ranks right under my #1 ramen spot which is tied between the Ajisen Ramen chain (because of the Ajisen Special ramen with spice bow) and Tampopo Ramen in Tempe, AZ.

First of all, they make their noodles in-house just like at Tampopo, and have one of the limited number of noodle making machines in the USA as well, I have only seen 3, Tampopo in Tempe AZ, Underground Ramen in SF, and this one, so it's always exciting. As expected, the noodles were top notch, and the broth was only below the best by the slightest of margins.

The thing that put this place at 5 stars for me was the fried pork belly that I ordered with my side of fried rice, O.M.G!!! That was soooooo good.  I requested that it's be crispy and it did not disappoint. Order fried rice with a  side of crispy pork belly when you go.

In conclusion, I love this place and will not be going back to Monta when I am in LV, just because Ramen KoBo is now on my list of not only faves in LV but top in my list overall.
Amazing, must try! Ordered Miso ramen, med spice, added corn, seaweed, bamboo shoots and egg!

This place is fu..ing greedy, I try to order a bowl of noodle and ask for a little bit extra soup and they have to charge me $2 extra and every little things charge extra.... $15 for a bowl of ramen probably is the most expensive I had. Arguing with me the whole 10 min it's unbelievable.
This place is amazing. The noodles are made right in front of you and you can watch. The black garlic sauce is a MUST! Everything is delicious and very reasonably priced.

We were visiting Vegas from Houston and were pleasantly supprised at the super great bowl of noodles put in front of us. The resturant is very small and we had to wait about 20 minutes but it was worth it. The service was fast and friendly. Also, I liked the fact that you could choose the level of spiciness which for me was mild and my wife hot. I can assure you there was a difference. Next time we are in Vegas which is one or twice a year we will return.
This ramen spot has turned into my 'go to', I eat here 2-3 times a week, since they opened and their ramen is consistently amazing. Can't compare other ramen spots, to this one. Highly recommended.

I've been here several times. Always good ramen. Noodles are tasty. Good noodle to broth ratio. I get medium and it definitely has plenty of heat for someone who likes spice. Staff is very nice and fast to turn tables. Good selection of add ins at decent prices. It's kind of annoying though that they close for a little while in the afternoon on weekdays. There have been a few times I ended up going to another restaurant because they were closed and I couldn't wait.
Great service!  Love the noodles made right in the shop.  Taste is delicious, and I will definitely be going back!

I'm glad more and more ramen restaurants are opening up in the southwest. This place is great! Small, friendly staff, quick service and delicious ramen!! My husband got the level 8 (4 chilis on the menu) was super hot but very delicious and I got the mild (2 chilis) I loved it!! We will be back soon!!

They had horrible service here I asked for a little bit extra soup and they're trying to charge extra money for a a little spoon full of soup that isn't going to hurt them when they gave me an order that did not even have enough soup to cover the noodles in the first place. They charge extra for every little thing and they drop calls if they don't feel like talking to you even when you're being polite and trying to explain to them what you want to order.

After I had told them just now about not putting enough soup in my noodles in the first place they then proceeded to not put any pork in my Tonkatsu i am very disappointed and wish that Munta Was close by and not across town someone need to manage this place better

This ramen shop definitely surprised me after reading and viewing all the reviews on here.  The broth is not exactly like Monta but good enough.  They do provide one slice of chasu BUT there is ground/minced pork(spicy) in the shoyu and tonkatsu options.  It is conveniently located in the south west of town which is great when I am craving a ramen fix and can't go all the way to Monta.   

The  Mentaiko bowl is a great side dish for a change of pallet.  How is your slurp game?!?
Too bad I do not live in Vegas or frequent as much...this place just opened and the food was great...need to find a place close by me...searching

I always order the Miso medium add extra mushrooms. The medium is spicy but tolerable. Their fried rice is the best I've ever had and this is what we order for our 18 mo old son. Even with all the veggies in it, he will almost finish all of it. The broth is delicious,  I love that they add roasted garlic and those (bamboo?) shoots and the Ramen is freshly made! They make it onsite. They have a variety of other ingredients that you can add for extra $$$ which if you're eyes are bigger than your stomach you may just end up spending $15+ on a bowl- but really- even without the extras- it is write home about good! Staff is always so welcoming and on top of it! This place is tiny, so just know you may experience somewhat of a wait. No worries- watch them make Ramen. Well worth it! My family and I love coming here.

Went here two days back-to-back. The first time was for a late-night dinner and the second time was right before dinner rush. Both times had excellent flavor of ramen. Well-seasoned, miso and tonkatsu broth soups was extremely flavorful! Noodles were thin and it was the perfect portion. 

Service was attentive. Food came out fairly quick. The only couple things that stops me giving this 4 stars is the fact that my bowl came out lukewarm to barely warm. My extra chashu was also cold in my soup. I'm talking like freshly sliced and pulled from the fridge type of cold. I figured whatever, it's still freaking delicious, it's also really, really busy on a weekend an hour before closing. 

The next day, I'm still craving ramen, so my friend and I go in and we order. I get a miso broth with mild spiciness, extra chashu, and nori. Same thing happens, chashu is less cold (still feels it was refrigerated) this time and ramen broth is still just warm, not hot. Like it's been sitting out for a while.
 
Both times, the pork chashu was just so-so, kind of flavorless. I'm not going to get a third time. Soft boiled eggs I had in my ramen both times were good, flavorful, perfectly made. 

I know I could have said something, but I didn't want to be known as "that person". I'm not a picky eater by any means either. The ramen is still amazing, service was fantastic, but I can't really overlook the  barely warm ramen. I don't need it scalding hot, just maybe a bit hotter like ramen should be. I'm still definitely coming back, and maybe I caught them on another off night. Or maybe a customer complained that the ramen was too hot before? I still recommend this place as a good casual eat, but I don't know about taking someone that's a bit more pickier than I am.

EDIT: Glad I'm not the only one that thinks the same thing about the cold chashu and broth.

The noodles were cooked to perfection with a nice bite, the broth was flavorful and rich. 
The spicy level satisfied my spicy cravings.  I personally prefer the curly noodles instead of the straight ones, but I really appreciate that they make their own ramen noodles.
The staff were very friendly and they were attentive to our needs. 
I will definitely come back here again if I find myself in the area.
Delicious  My husband and I were pleasantly surprised when we tried this place. Even my toddler at a large portion of noodles and rice.

I've been here two or three time on separate Vegas excursions. Great food! Definitely worth the wait. I highly recommend adding the black oil to your ramen. It's amazing and really changes the experience. A+!

I ordered the kimchi fried rice to go. The restaurant is really small, so I'm not sure if I would ever stay there to eat. I was disappointed that you cold only get pork if you wanted meat added to the rice but I dealt with it. It wasn't spicy at all and I didn't see that you could request it spicy but maybe I'm wrong. For the price I thought I would've received a bit more but I guess it was enough. I plan to go back again and try the ramen next time.

Amazing place. Great service and great food. I am so happy that you guys open this location. I tried Miso mild . It was spicy enough but has a flavor. I usually don't like spicy food but I like this spicy. It was just right for me. They also making own noodle!! I will definitely come back again.

It was okay.. Def not monta.Monta is wayyyy better, We got it Togo they didn't give us 2 kimchi like I ordered & we got charged for a extra shoyu ramen that no one ate. The kimchi fried rice was okay but nothing like montas. Won't be eating here again I'd much rather drive across town to monta.
Good location and the food was very good.  The broth was a bit salty but tasty.  Pricing is reasonable and large party sitting may be a problem.  Service could be better to make one feels welcome.
I had a tonkatsu for lunch is good...service is great...I need to try the other item on the menu....hungry for more

This is probably the only Ramen place here in the Valley that I keep coming back to. Their ramen is fantastic and the broth is always rich in flavor. I am knocking one star due to some missing toppings that, for me, completes a Ramen (their ramen has no soft boiled egg, you have to pay for it as an addon for example). Try their pork belly bowl also.

I had better ramen from
Other places! The broth was not tasty at all and the noodles are overlooked. What bothers me though is the cook making the fried rice and other food, which I did not orders, he was kinda heavy guys so he was sweating inside the kitchen of course because of boiling water and broth etc... He was wearing gloves but he kept
Touching his face and hat with sweat then continue on cooking food. I just don't think that was very appetizing for me... I left after I ate the nitamago (eggs) lol... But no space as well...
There's probably just 25-30 people capacity. So if there's a line or waiting to be seated I would leave and go somewhere not worth it for ur 2 mins waiting for a bowl of not so good ramen
Has its own noodle maker. So far the best place for ramen, pork belly rice is also good. Favorite to go place

I just found my favorite ramen spot in town. Got bar seating as soon as I walked in. Service was above average. I ordered the tonkatsu ramen and pork belly bowl. The ramen was excellent. The noodles are made fresh in-house. You can actually see this in action right before you walk into the main entrance. The broth was not salty. This was very appetizing since all of the ramen spots I've tried in town are too salty to the point where I am unable to finish the soup. You can easily distinguish the fresh tasting noodles. It was very smooth and the texture was perfect. This bowl was the first ramen bowl that I have ever finished. I only got the half bowl of the pork belly. It was served over rice. The belly was sliced very thin with just the right amount of seasoning. The rice used is the sushi grade quality. Tender with a hint of sweetness. All the condiments were neatly arranged. I also like that they still have napkin dispensers at arm's reach. Prices are very reasonable. I highly recommend this place and I will definitely return when I am craving authentic Japanese ramen.
Drove by this place and wanted some soup. Great choice! My GF and I loved the ramen here! It was delicious and the fried rice was extra tasty too! Highly recommend!

Broth needs to be strained one, it's too oily esp with the ground meat they add as a topping (on that, I'd rather rave 2 pieces of chashu than this ground meat that disappears into the broth).  Also the broth needs more salt; very under seasoned once the noodles are in.
They should eat monta's and theirs side by side and do some tweaking.  Like mine was the miso one and it still lacked salt.
My noodle texture was good, like the thick noodles at monta.
Hope this place works out because it's so close to my house.

Went here last night for the first time with my husband, my best friend & her husband. Pretty cool place! Although the place was small, I was quite impressed with how well the staff was at handling the seating situation. I've never seen anyone wait longer than ten minutes!

Right when you walk in and get seated, the server says something in Japanese... not sure what, I'm assuming it's along the lines of "New meat coming thru.." lol or more like "Welcome our guests.." and then the entire staff responds back in Japanese with a welcome! I'm not sure, but it's pretty cool.
So you order a ramen bowl by the broth & all the bowls come with the same things. You can take things out & then add things for an additional price. They also have a spiciness level... so if you're not into spice at all I would stick to original.

Our friends ordered their favorite shoyu ramen bowl & added a few things. My husband & wanted to stay close to home just ordered a pork tonkotsu (pork broth) ramen & I got the miso (pork & chicken broth) ramen. They also got their own pork belly bowls, but hubby & I decided to share.

I have to say the broth was rich, the noodles were fresh (they make them in-house), & it was pretty delicious. I loved the pork belly bowl though because it was super fatty & the taste was light but extremely yummy.... the fatty goodness from the fried pork belly soaked thru the rice & mmmm, it was delicious.

Not a ramen person, more of a pho lover but I would come back here every so often just for something different.

Ramen KoBo is a small noodle joint with a significant wait time during prime lunch hours. We waited as a party of four for Saturday lunch for about 20-25 minutes before being seated. The service was great and friendly, so let's cut right to the ramen. We had the tonkatsu and miso ramen plus a small rice bowl with salmon roe. Everything was delicious. The tonkatsu broth is on point! I added black garlic oil for an additional $1.00 which made the broth a lot more earthy and savory. It is an intense flavor so I wouldn't recommend for those who prefer a lighter broth. You can add extra toppings for additional cost to what they already provide. The noodles had a great texture. BEWARE the spice level - I asked for mild and it felt like medium to me - if unsure you should just ask for the hot sauce on the side.

The only suggestion I would make is to give one more slice of meat for the standard ramen bowl. One thin slice is a bit stingy. But the rest of the food is great and if you like noodles (and don't care too much about meat) you will enjoy this place.

The ramen was really tasty. I thought the broth had a lot of flavor and the noodles were perfect. The restaurant is very small, they only have 4 tables that seat 4 and a bar that seats 8 or 10. The service was great, even at the bar the waitresses tend you to you which was very nice. The menu is small as well, offering 4 flavors of ramen, and a few different side dishes like, pork belly and kimchi. Overall it was a good experience.

Some of the best ramen in town! They make the ramen noodles in house! You can choose your level of spiciness, which I love. Great customer service too!

During the week they close in between lunch and dinner, so be sure to check their hours before you go! On Saturday and Sunday they don't close between lunch and dinner, they're open all day. Try this restaurant!

Obsessed with this place!!! So delicious!! Went with a coworker during our lunch for the first time & we keep coming back! I'm craving it right now lol. Service is quick (well during lunch- typically 12pm) so we make it back in time to work. Taking everyone I know here- every chance I get!

Best ramen I've got ever! I usually went to 'monta' near china town which is the first ramen restaurant of the company, also known as 'Mon restaurant group' to enjoy my favorite shoyu ramen. It's another version of their ramen restaurant. Soup had very deep flavor, and the 'home made noodle' was very tasty. For this time, it seems like they are pursuing even high quality ramen. Much more outstanding than any other ramen store in town!

Came here for lunch for the first time on a Monday afternoon. Located in the new center next to subway near Starbucks and EOS fitness, this is the new location by the highly known Monta Ramen/Sushi Mon group on the Southwest side of Vegas ! 

We met up at 1230 and instantly got a table. The store itself is small, length wise, similar to Monta in seating capacity. Decor is nice and simple, with long wooden boards oriented vertically  lined up the wall for a nice high feeling. Different from the usual Monta decor. Also, they make their own ramen, in house, in the glass room, facing the exterior of the restaurant ! Mmm love fresh noodles ! I dont care if its pasta or la mien or ramen or udon. So good ! This is the main reason why i came to try this place ! 

Service was quick and friendly. We were asked our drink orders as soon as we sat down, by 2 different people, in a spread of like 10 seconds. Lol 

We had waited for our late friend before we had ordered our food. 

----------------------------------------------------

Their menu is very simple. If anything, its identical to Monta's except with the choice of a spicy level. 

1. Pick Your Broth - Shoyu Ramen (Chicken Broth), Tonkotsu Ramen (Pork Broth), Miso Ramen (Pork & Chicken Broth), and Vege Ramen (Vegetable Broth). All priced at $8.95. 

Shoyu, Tonkotsu, and Miso Ramen comes with 1 slice of Chashu Pork, Fried Garlic, Kikurage Black mushrooms, Bamboo Shoots, Fresh Green Chives, Ground Pork, Sesame Oil, and Shredded Red Pepper. 

Vege Ramen comes with Fried Onion, Shredded Green Onion, Tofu, Spinach, Corn, Ginger, and Fresh Green Chives. 

2. Pick Your Spicy Level. Original, Mild, Medium, Hot, Fire. 

3. Pick Your EXTRA Topping (Prices Vary) - Chashu pork/chicken, Ground pork/chicken, Spicy Fish Roe (Mentaiko), Kikurage Black Mushroom, Shredded Green Onion, Soft Boiled Egg (Nitamago), Mustard Green (Takana), Spinach, Kimchi, Bamboo Shoots, Nira Chive, Roasted Seaweed (Nori), Black Garlic Oil, Bean Sprouts (Moyashi), Corn, Butter, and EXTRA NOODLE. 

Also the usual side dishes available. Fried Rice, Kimchi Fried Rice, Pork Belly Bowl, Chashu Bowl, and Mini Mentaiko Bowl. 

----------------------------------------------------

I had ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, FIRE, with a soft boiled egg. Normally if this was for dinner or something, id probably get extra noodles too, but i just woke up maybe an hour or so prior to this, so my stomach is like meh xD haha can't eat that much. 

Fairly quick to deliver the food, after the table next too us got theirs. 

Noodles are unique to this location. If you had ever had Monta previously, its more towards thick than thin. But not too thick. So in between the two. Noodles cooked very well. Al dente. Perfect chewiness. Best part of the meal ! I want more ! but i was full. xD 

Broth is flavorful but still pretty heavy, like the usual tonkotsu. FIRE spicy level adds a pretty good kick to it all. 

Fried garlic is something new. Though its more like a roasted garlic vs a fried garlic. But i cant complain since i LOVE garlic. Had to throw in another spoonful of garlic anyway hehe :P 

At Monta, you'd normally receive i believe 2-3 slices of chashu pork. But at Kobo, you get 1 slice of chashu pork, but in return, you get a small mound of ground pork. Not too bad. Their chashu pork seems pretty similar to their sister locations. Fatty xD Ground pork not overcooked and rough. Fairly decent. 

Nitamago was cooked nicely. Maybe a little over a perfect soft boiled. Still has a nice golden, rich, and creamy yolk. 

Aside from the normal toppings, the chives was a nice touch. I am a HUGE fan of chives and love anything with them. 

Overall, not bad. Close convenient location for the people who live in the SW or a teasing/torture style for those who walk out of the EOS gym. Nice to have more options now in the area. Would be nice to pick up some food after work from the hospital if i work late.

Awesome ramen place on the west side!! I went here on a Friday night around 6:30 & it was packed. I don't think you can make reservations, or at least you can't through Open Table, I didn't call and ask but I'm assuming not. So get there early or at least be prepared to wait a bit. 

While your waiting you do get to watch the noodles being made which is really cool. 

It didn't take long to get a spot at the bar since there were just two of us. The ramen was amazing, we both ordered Veggie Ramen and added egg, mushroom & bean sprouts. Our order came very quickly & it was soooo good! Perfect for a chilly windy Vegas night. 

The ambiance is exactly what you would expect from a ramen spot, clean, light & minimal decor. It was super busy so it was a bit noisy, but not annoyingly so. Our server was great & super friendly. 

Can't wait to go back

Been wanting to try this place specifically from their fresh ramen noodles.  Kind of disappointed that the noodles were not made to order.  What's the point of having the glass room with the machine but it's not being used? Lol 

Luckily from the texture of the noodles, it does seem freshly made (ahead of time).

Another disappointment was the taste of the broth.  We ordered miso and tonkasu and it both fell short. Not to mention we also asked for spicy and it wasn't as spicy as we imagined 3 pepper signs to be.

First time having chives in Ramen rather than scallions??? Cha Shui was sliced super thin. Also add ons toppings were around $1-1.50, more than average ramen joints around town.

All in all, pretty disappointed.  For around the same price I prefer Monta, Sora, or Ramen Tatsu

It was my first time here and my experience was so-so, bordering on nice.

First, the ramen. I ordered tonkotsu ramen, with extra noodles and black garlic oil on the side. At first glance, the bowl was aesthetically pleasing, and looking at it will make you hungry. The first thing I tasted was the stock. This stock was light and on the creamier side of pork bone soup. My only gripe with this is that the stock was a bit too light. All the toppings overpowered the broth and stood out too much. Any addition of the black garlic oil along with my second round of noodles overpowered the bowl completely. The noodles, however, were great: excellent bite out of the bowl, not too tough, not too soft. The noodles made much of the ramen eating experience.

Service was pretty nice. The lady at the front guided us to our seats and a young man took our orders. Our waters were refilled at a reasonable pace, food came out quick, and the staff was friendly.

If there was a half star option I'd give this a 3.5.

Local, Authentic Ramen-ya in SW Vegas. We've been a few times already, and even recommended it to family that live in the area. The place is tiny, so expect a wait.  The menu isn't massive, but what they do have, they do WELL.  The Ramen is fresh, and made ON SITE. You can't go wrong with that. Broths are tasty (I've had the Miso and Shoyu) and you can get a ton of add ins for a fairly reasonable price. Definitely hope this place stays open for a long time!

Great food and service.  Noodles made fresh in front of you.  Their mild is spicy so watch out.  It's really good but has a kick.  Hard to find seating so come early or wait.  Definitely build more of those in summerlin .  Lol
Deliciousness! Probably the best ramen I have ever eatten......................................... .

My wife and I enjoy this place very much. Good service, the food is excellent and the atmosphere is nice. Some complain that the restaurant is small, but most likely their the type to spend a dinner checking their phones instead of enjoying the company they have with them.

Do not overthink it! This place is as authentic and friendly as a restaurant can be. The staff is very attentive and achieve culinary perfection. I enjoyed the dining experience and look forward for more to come.

*español* este restaurante es autentico y determinado a traer una experiencia inolvidable con gran attencion al cliente. No lo piensen dos veces, este lugar vale la visita.
I had the miso ramen and it was great.  I will add this to my favorites in Vegas to visit.  The service is fast and the food is very fresh.

Food: The broth from kobo ramen still can't compare to Sora Ramen, for a Ramen it's ok. The Side dishes though were really good, I would recommend getting the pork belly bowl with pickled green onions, the pork belly were stir fried with salt and some sesame oil, this combination in my subjective opinion was great flavor wise.

Ambiance: The decor is the typical ramen setting small dining area with a bar and an added bonus of seeing how the ramen is made. Adds to the experience of Ramen eating.

Service: Service was good, the waitresses were attentive to our needs especially with the kids. 

Overall: It's ok for a ramen and would be good to view how ramen is made first hand. I would recommend getting the side dishes in addition to the ramen.

This only being my 3rd ramen place I've ever visited, I'd have to say this is my favorite one yet at least in Vegas. I had the spicy pork and the broth was tasty. In this sense, it is better than home made stuff, and I've cooked for years so being creative is the one thing that makes a bowl of noodles for me. The convenience of its location and my attentive server, Yuri, made my experience a delight. It's my ramen place after I get off work.
This place is super cute, really small industrial feel has a wooden bar and they have vegetarian options! It's perfect for date night if you like ramen
I love this place! Every time I go the ramen is perfect! I wish the place was a little bit bigger, but it is what it is. I love it!
Always hits the spot. Lucky to live so close by. Food is excellent, service is always fast and friendly.

Tonight we decided to try ramen kobo we walked right and was promptly seated. We sat at the bar which isn't too  bad. I order the tonkotsu ramen and my fiancé got the Sho yu ramen. We shared a pork belly rice bowl also. If you never had their ramen spicy order it plain. It was good but kind spicy for me. The portions were good and the taste was there but the chili kinda too spicy for me but I still ate it. I will be  back again.

Delicious ramen joint in the southwest part of the valley.  It's always been busy the few times we've been there.  The menu is clear and makes things easy to order if you're not a frequent ramen diner.  I like the setup and being able to sit at the bar and watch the kitchen work.  Great experience and location!

5 stars for service, very Friendly staff! And the experience was cool (watching them make the noodles). I also liked that we had to sit so close to the other guests because it's a tiny place. Other than not being sure how to sit on the booth side because I didn't wanna slide my butt by anyone lol, we were almost forced to talk to the other couples next to us which turned into great conversation.
but the food.. why we're all here.. was just ok. My friend didn't even finish is ramen. He said he wasn't impressed (he's a chef so he's had some good stuff) so said he'd rather have something else. We got the buns, which I'd give 4 stars. But we both agreed the broth was super bland and the noodles could have been a little more cooked. The couple to my left also commented on the almost flavorless broth

Great Local Ramen place. I ordered take out and they put the soup (liquid) and the rest of the ingridients into 2 separate containers - so that I could mix it at home. Excellent flavor and overall preparation. You can order online - or they have iPads to order in the store. I will be back.

The pork broth ramen was good.  Very similar to other pork broth ramen I have had. 

Menu is very basic. Ramen, fried rice and 2 other things. Wanted appetizers but none were offered on the menu. Would have given 4 stars if there were appetizers.

Also they have some beer but no other alcohol.

Very small but came late so no wait.

This is a cute little ramen shop in the Southwest Part of town. It's very small, always packed and not enough parking outside. As you walk in to the right is a glass room where fresh ramen is being made, though that was pretty awesome. This is one of the best ramen spots around town, I love the flavors they offer and you don't have to add extra flavors. I like to get the miso and medium. As an appetizer they offer a small and regular sized pork belly bowl which is my favorite thing on the menu. The size of the pork belly is perfect on top of a bed of rice and topped off with chopped green onions. I always fall in my order because it's always busy!

I am here waiting in line. I was here promptly at 5:00pm and placed my to go order via ipad at the restaurant. It took them 45 minutes to get me my food! Find another place to eat if you are actually hungry.

Definite room for improvement. 

As a few others have stated, I've been to, and will keep frequenting the other Monta locations but this one has to work on a few things. 

In my opinion two major components in ramen make it work... Noodles and soup. Noodles here are thinner than the other two Monta shops and in my opinion not as good.  They were soft and had no texture imho. It may have been an off day but the other two Monta shops don't have off days with their noodles. Soup was decent but much less flavorful and had lots of floating fat chunks which the other two shops don't. I don't think it's a flavor thing, instead maybe rushing the process of the broth. 

My mild miso came with bean sprouts which I never ordered, and after taking them out my server noticed and made a comment about me not liking them... Sorry but I didn't order bean sprouts, but was definitely charged for it. Weird. Minor mistake but left a bad taste in my mouth...could've been the chunks of fat 

If you're going to mention you're a part of the Monta family, understand you'll be held to high standards. Those standards have not been met at this location just yet.

This is definitely the best ramen I've tried in town. I have to limit myself or I would probably end up eating here multiple times a week. There isn't very much room for seating, but I've never had to wait longer than ten minutes. The broth here is perfect, the chashu pork is so tender, and it has become my ultimate comfort food. Staff is super friendly, always greets you when you walk in and thanks you when you leave. I love love love this place so much and can't say enough good things about it!

The waiter took forever to take our order and when we got our fried rice waited another 30 mins to find out they forgot our ramen. It wasn't even busy rush hour was over. So idk what happen there very disappointing. This place use to prompt and efficient *smh*

Good experience here overall. 

Very small restaurant and you get hit by cold air every time the door opens. 

The menu is very much "Build-your-own"  You can choose the broth, spice level and and extra ingredients. 

I felt it was slightly expensive as I added a soft boiled egg and extra pork and my total was over $13. My gf did the same and added shaved green onion so hers came out over $14. 

I ordered the pork broth, chashu pork and egg and medium spice and it was very good. They handmake their own noodles which you can see through a window as you walk through the entrance. 

Only reason it doesn't get 4 stars is the price. I could get close to the same thing for $5 cheaper.

From reading the reviews posted here on Yelp; maybe I was expecting more than I got.
Went for a weekend dinner, sat at the bar since the tables were full.  Had the miso ramen & a side of fried rice.  

The Miso Ramen was OK.  It lacked depth in the flavor.  The house made noodles were the straight variety, so it wasn't able to pick up lots of the broth like a wavy noodle would.  Overall, was just OK.  Not as expected.

Was able to taste the Tonkatsu Ramen.  The broth had more depth, but didn't knock my socks off.  Just OK.

The fried rice lacked pizzazz. Was just content.  Another OK vote.

This location is very small.  Maybe 7 tables (2 to 4 people) and about 10 bar spaces.

I really wanted to try this place. The reviews made it sound amazing. I ordered a Chicken Ramen, with egg (I love egg), seaweed, corn and their regular toppings. It was too bland for me. It did have a little spice but it was a weird kind of spiciness. I can't really explain it. It was just weird! It tasted bland but then I'd get a hint of hot. I ate half of it because I was hungry. I carried out so I can't comment on the service that much. I felt they were polite to me on the phone and when I went to pick up my order. Everything was cooked well, it just needed more flavor. I felt like i was drinking water. Ive had good ramen and bad ramen, this was just okay.

Best Ramen in Vegas. 
Noodles are made fresh in house daily. Broth is on point. Just as good to dine in or carry out.

Great ramen joint, I've been coming here pretty routinely for the past year. I've had a great experience up until my visit earlier this month. I used to love this place all due to their delicious pork chashu, which was creamy, full of flavor, and would fall apart at the attempt of picking it up with the chopsticks. 

However, during my last 2 visits this month, the pork chashu was served cold, as if they just pulled it out of their fridge. The broth is hot and the meat is cold? (Wut?) Not only that, but it is now very tough and flavorless as well, almost to the point of needing other utensils to cut it.

I asked the servers what changed and they said nothing but I've been here enough to recognize the difference. I probably won't return.

Soup is not hot. It's warm. Server Rachel didn't even bother replacing it upon request instead she's going to charge additional for a hotter broth. Bad customer service. I live in the area but won't recommend. Very bad service.

I highly recommended this place if you are craving for a good Ramen..prices are reasonable. Location is perfect and the most important the service is fast and very good! I only wish they can expend the restaurant little bigger, so they can accommodate more of us instead of sometime getting hustle with the wait. Overall, this is one of the best Ramen in the Southwest area.

This is so close to my house that I was really hoping that it would be good, but I was wrong. We love Monta but this lacks in comparison. We ordered our usual, the Miso Ramen, original. The broth was bland, no depth of flavor, other ingredients seemed off also. The service was ok but not exceptional, especially as it was not busy. They seemed more concerned that their wi-fi went out and the music was off than anything else. I know it hasn't been open for long but we will probably not take a chance on a second visit. Very disappointed!
I fucking love this place. The service is great and the food is alwaysss amazing! My partner and I usually order vegan ramen and fried rice to share. Never disappointed with Kobo!

They make their own noodles in the house! Believe the owner also owns Monta so you know what you're getting. 

Service is always friendly. I only wish that they would have gyoza on the menu. 

Aside from ramen, kimchi fried rice is a must try.
Excellent ramen!! Great fast service!! Highly recommend the miso!!!! So filling and delicious!! Opens 11:30am until 2:00am!!
Very good. The spicy is as advertised. I loved it.  And the location is great from all directions in southwest Vegas. I will be coming back!!

This place only sits near 20 so there will always be a wait! But trust me when I say that the wait is worth it. My wife and I got fried rice to share then we each got a raman bowl. Everything was well worth it. We will be back, and we will recommend this place to others!

My first time here with a group of seven and we came in about an hour and a half before they closed. I felt like one of the waitresses were rushing us while she was taking our order, which might've caused her to switch some orders and get orders completely wrong.

The presentation of the food was great, but the broth was pretty salty and my pork was very fatty. Just thinking of my order as I write this review makes me sick.

The service wasn't great either. They can't keep track of what everyone ordered. And when they brought out the check they kept pestering my boyfriend about how many Cokes we had ordered, which was only one. They still kept asking like we were hiding another can of Coke somewhere.

I would not bring my business back to this place. If i'm ever on that side of town again with an empty stomach, I'll just go to IKEA and get some Swedish meatballs.

Tried this place the other day and it was ok. The place is pretty small, a bar area with about 7-8 seats and 5-6 smaller tables against the wall. We were lucky and got a seated right away, a few minutes later people were waiting in line. 

We tried the kimchi fried rice with pork belly on top and this was delicious! The fried rice was better than the ramen. 

I tried the Miso ramen spicy level mild and it had a nice kick to it. What I don't like is that it does not come with egg while places like Sora include egg with the ramen. The broth was ok, I have had better broth. Another thing I don't like is that our ramen came with 1 tiny piece of Chasu, they want to charge for egg and extra Chasu while other places give you decent portion of Chasu without having to order extra! They also don't have any appetizers like gyoza, you can only get ramen and fried rice. 

The restaurant is small and tight, people bumped into me while I was seated at the bar area. The parking is also pretty small, cars were waiting in line and fighting for spots. I would not mind all this if the ramen was amazing but it was not. Will go elsewhere for ramen without all the hassle. 

Definitely not good for large parties, parties larger than 4 are not recommended! If you want to check out the hype then go, but if you just want good ramen so somewhere else.
Food/service was amazing!! By the way did you guys happen to find a debit card? It reads homar macias-duenez i think i left it.

Dropped by randomly with my girlfriend checking out how this place compares to all the other ramen spots in Vegas. This place is located on Durango and warm springs infront of EOS, which is convenient because it is close to a big residential area. The shop is pretty small and I would assume on a busy night during the weekend there might be a wait. I came here pretty late on a week day, so I was seated immediately. I couldn't remember the server's name, but she was friendly and made sure we were okay throughout the entire experience. I ordered the Spicy shoyu ramen and my girlfriend got the tonkatsu ramen. The Spicy ramen had a nice kick to it and would surely get your nose running! The soup was good and I liked how the noodles were chewy. I got to try the tonkatsu ramen as well and I liked the soup base. It was thicker than the soup you get at sora, but it definitely had good flavor. Portions were good and we both left full! If you're in the area definitely try this place out.
Absolutely delicious! The best ramen house that I've been too. Everyone was very nice and fast service. And they make their noodles in house, definitely can taste the difference.

Maybe I was so hungry, I had order more and more. 
Felt not enough in terms of amount. 

Will visit again to see if they are making the real bone soup.

Food: Good
Price: Good
Service: Good
Parking: Good

Went here sooo many times & will never get tired of it. I have tried many ramen places in vegas and esp. in OC, and this place seems to be the best. The flavorings and customer service are always on point. Very consistent. The "Shoyu" has been my boyf's go to option.
Good place for ramen house. Somewhat comparable to some Ramen noodles house in Seattle.

Came in to get a quick bite after the gym, before running some errands. I got seated fairly quick and the server waisted no time getting my drink order, and since its scorching I appreciated that. My server name was Ryan and he was very helpful. Since I was looking to get something quick, I ordered the pork belly rice bowl. It's cheap and delicious, will be coming back for ramen soon 

Came here for my second time with a friend and this blonde Asian chick greeted me. This lady is extremely rude as far as giving service. I asked if I can order ahead for a friend and she insisted no.. I'm like my buddy is going to be here in 2 mins can I just order.. than she started comparing what others have done saying their friends will be coming in 5 mins and show up 10-20 mins later. Seriously?? Maybe your friends not mine. I looked at the name tag and her name is Rachel

I feel like I'm a broth girl. I'm very big on broth. And lucky for Ramen Kobo, I was impressed with their regular miso soup ramen. The noodles were thick and delicious. Even the pork was good and I feel like I'm picky when it comes to liking any kind of pork found in ramen.

I just feel like the temperature of the food could have been a tad bit hotter upon first taste. I would much rather have my food burning hot and wait for it to cool down than to receive it luke warm.

I'm willing to give this place another shot since it's so close to my house and I have an obsession with noodles and soup.

I love this ramen place! I got the medium spice level cause I NEVER get mild anything, but it ended up being a little too spicy for me. Still good though. Next time I came I got mild and it was prefect! Still a good amount of spice!
The Miso Ramen (fire hot) was kickin and delicious. The fried rice is very flavorful. The staff is very friendly and attentive. I wish I lived in town so I could eat here more often.

Came here for lunch since it's pretty close to where I live. 

It's a fairly small restaurant but has pretty awesome ambiance. You can see the chefs cook right in front of you and there are these machines that make the noodles behind a glass window.

Servers were quick and friendly. However I knocked off a star for the actual broth. I was pretty stoked to have a spiciness option for the ramen; however, the spice seems to be just an chili oil or some sort and made the broth super oily to which I couldn't really savor the flavor of it since the broth itself was no longer as creamy or thick like it should be. 

But overall, not bad. The restaurant is still fairly new so 4 stars.
Excellent! Noodles are amazing , ordered miso medium spicy , spice level was great , wife and i were both very happy we will be coming back .
I love their wheat hand made ramen noodle there! Soup broth is tasty too!!! i love here #2 in lasvegas! i love Ramen Sora is my favorite #1.

Goods
1. Ramen with various levels of spice
2. Other offerings including: Japanese friend rice/Cha-Han and Gyoza
3. They make their own noodles here and you can watch the noodles being made (see photo)
4. Various broths to choose from: shio, miso, shoyu (see menu photo)

Ambiance:
1. Small, a little cramped (in the spirit of traditional Tokyo style ramen houses)
2. Wait time may add up depending on peak times, don't forget to write your name on the waiting list/seating when you go in
3. Half booths and chairs
4. I like that you can watch the noodles being made, you know they are not using some freeze dried noodles etc.

Service
1. Efficient and friendly
2. I have been here twice, I have never had a problem
3. Server is also cashier

Mojo:
1. Ramen is pretty good here, I do think I prefer ramen elsewhere.  Spice level goes nothing to mild, medium, hot.  I'd say mild can be pretty spicy, they were very friendly and offered to include it on the side which is nice.
2. Cha-Han, fried rice, was good.  Very umami.

I ordered the kimchi fried rice to go.  The cashier advised me of my total $8.93 which was a bit high to me, but overlooked it. I took my order and left. My kimchi fried rice was good, they added my condiments of red chili oil, garlic and soy sauce , . My issue was how the cashier told me my total, including the gratuity. If I want to pay a gratuity for take out I will. When was it mandatory to pay this. I feel taken advantage of. Next time I will be aware.

Nothing that I could possibly complain about this place. Love how there's a ramen place outside of spring mountain and on the southwest side of town. Super clean place. Way bigger than monta which is great. Love how there's a section where u can see them make fresh noodles. I was skeptical about the broth and taste since I would compare it to monta which is by far the best ramen in town, but actually, ramen kobo is almost at their level. Broth was good. The spicy hot broth was super good, if u like spicy. We order the tonkotsu with nori and egg like usual. We also order the pork belly bowl to share and I was also skeptical because at monta, their pork belly bowl looks different and is super bomb but kobos bowl was good too. I think it needs a little more flavor or sauce to mix with the rice though to make it . Other than that, they were able to accommodate 7 of us and the wait wasn't bad at all unlike monta where u gotta wait for a while for a big group like that.

Stopped in with my party of 4- me, my mother, my teenage son, my two year old and my baby. We were told it was a 20 min wait. The girl assumed we needed a high chair, which we didn't. Our wait time was based on my party needing a high chair. There was an open table when we got there so our 20 minute wait time was for nothing. My two year old doesn't eat ramen, so I brought him some macaroni, which the restaurant doesn't allow. I wasn't going to sit there and eat while my two year old watched us. I understand not being able to bring outside food in to their restaurant, but we were getting 5 meals plus drinks. You'd think they could make an exception for a two year old. Either way, we left and took our business elsewhere. The 2 stars were for the 20 minutes of my time that was completely wasted.

Place: nice and clean, they just opened.
Service: fast and friendly, there were many workers
Noodle: Just okay. Not too bad.
Broth: too much fat floating, some people liked it, I don't. Maybe they can have the customer choose the level of grease besides the level of spiciness too.
Price: a bit pricey for the portion size.
Overall, it's an okay place

Very cozy place
Food came right away and no confusion with the order
Since it's our 1st time here , we would give this place another try
My wife ordered the spicy and not spicy tonkatsu soup
The spicy noodle soup is so much better
We recommend this place 
We like it

Visited Ramen Kobo for the first time.  I was not blown away but I was not disappointed.  I ordered the Shoyu Ramen.  Tasty and light.  Just the way I like it.  I will definitely would like to visit here again next time I'm in town.  I would skip the ground pork this time cuz I felt it overwhelmed the chicken broth flavor.

If you want fast service and good food, this is a good place.

Noodle making factory drew my attention. 

Super cute spot, not very big but loved the counter top seating. Front row to see how all the yumminess is created. All ramen used is made in house so its fresh for each order. 

Miso ramen spice hot added soft boiled egg, seaweed and bamboo shots. Ramen was really good, broth was full of flavor. 
Chashu bowl was really good too..large peices of pork, scallions and shredded nori over rice. Extremely tasty.
Pork belly bowl was ok, nothing too special.

I love that so many ramen places are popping up around my house!

Pretty good ramen. 
I wish I left my order all original to give it a more equal comparison to other Vegas ramen. Instead I got too excited and ordered the tonkatsu with black garlic oil and spice level hot. This ramen joint is about the spice level so be a bit adventurous with your spice level. It isn't as spicy as I thought it would be but I have been told that my level of spicy is pretty much lava. Next time I will get spice level fire. Mind this, you can ask for chili on the side if you want to be cautious. The chili they use has a good kick that hits you in the back of the throat but it does go away fairly quickly. It's not smokey the way some dried chili oils are. Kobo's chili is a ground dried chili with oil rather than an oil with dried chili bits in it. This allows the chili oil to not overpower or sit on top of the broth. Normally the oil will add extra fat/heaviness to the already rich tonkatsu broth but it doesn't. I would recommend people to add on extra chashu. You only get one slice in the regular order but the extra comes with 4 slices. The noodles are a little thicker since they are homemade. It's good and you can taste the freshness BUT I am a thin ramen noodle kind of girl. 
Let's compare Kobo to two other ramen places: Moko and Monta. Kobo is definitely way better than Moko. It's plain and simple that Kobo's flavor is just taste better. I have tried Moko on many occasions and it's not bad. Kobo's broth surpasses Moko's broth. Now compared to Monta, Kobo is just a step behind. Yes Kobo is the product of Monta, but the only reason for my opinion is the noodles. Like I said before, I am a thin noodle person. I prefer the snap of the thin noodles rather than the softer homemade noodles. Both broths are fantastic. The chashu is fantastic. Service is great. Just because I prefer Monta's noodles does not mean I hate Kobo. This was my first visit but not the last. Definitely my new ramen place. 

Added note: the parking is soooooooooooo much better than Monta's parking lot. I have changed dinner plans before when Monta didn't have any parking in the parking lot or side streets.

This place is delicious. The menu is small, simple but everything is so flavorful. 2 dollar bottles of beer (not happy hour pricing ! But every day - all the time.) you can see the ramen maker when you first walk in which is super enchanting. This is my 3rd visit and it gets 4 stars because the service is kinda slow for such a small space. Everything thing else about the place 5 stars!

Honestly my FAVORITE ramen place in Vegas! The options of heat in your ramen makes me love ramen even more, along with their consistency of broth, noodles, and delicious meat! Do expect a wait on Friday nights, since it is a traditional setting of a ramen place being quite small. But I PROMISE it's worth the wait! I can't help but give a great tip since the service there is phenomenal every time I go. I can't visit any other ramen place now

Convenient location with ample parking space! Definitely a plus when compared to Monta on Spring Mountain. :)

I went around lunch on opening day, so there was no wait and we were seated right away. The place is nice and small, like a lot of ramen places in town. You are greeted by everyone once you walk in, and to the right, you can see the workers making fresh noodles! Since this restaurant faces West, I'd hate to be making noodles with the sun blazing in my eyes.

We were asked what we wanted to drink shortly after sitting down (Got our usual water with lemon). The waiter had to check if they had lemon slices. xD I don't blame them, since it IS their opening day, and still pretty early on, so I'm guessing they are still trying to figure things out. They didn't have any :( But hopefully they will in the future.

We had a party of 4, and I had the original shoyu ramen (no spicy) with nitamago. Each both of ramen (minus the vege ramen) comes with chashu pork, fried garlic, kikurage black mushrooms, bamboo shoots, fresh green chives, ground pork, sesame oil, and shredded red pepper. The broth was fatty and flavorful; a perfect five stars. The fresh homemade ramen - that's what makes this review a 4 star. It's not that the ramen was bad, it's just not really to my liking. I'm more of a fan of the thick noodles from Monta, which has a completely different texture. Also, even after soaking the noodles in the broth for a while, it still tasted a bit bland. On the other hand, the chashu pork had a great fat to meat ratio, and they actually had a whole clove of fried garlic in my broth. Yum. =] Also, the nitamago was cooked to soft-boiled perfection. Gotta love that runny yolk! The black mushrooms, bamboo shoots, fresh green chives, ground pork, etc are as expected. No complaints there.

I also got to try the broth of the Miso ramen with Hot spicy (level three spicy of four). There was a kick to it, but it faded quickly and didn't linger like a lot of other spicy foods. So even if you can't handle spicy like me, you should be okay with a level one or two spicy.

I'll be back to try the other broths as well as the rice. Keep it up!

Wonderful staff and delicious food! First time here tonight and left full and happy! Just a bit of a wait. It's a cozy restaurant and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Noodles are soft and delish. The ramen portions are excellent, chashu pork tender and flavorful and the broth is smooth and rich. Will definitely be back again soon!

I was excited to finally see a ramen place open up on the south west side of town! It does save me from having to drive all the way to Chinatown for a good bowl. Out of all the spots that are close by this is the only place that has solid bowl of ramen. 

They make their noodles fresh. I like thicker chewy noodles but theirs are not bad at all. I like how you can pick your spice level. I always get the miso ramen with egg at medium spice. Perfect for a cold day. 

Also, their pork belly bowl is a must if you have the room. They have a small bowl that you can get. It's also another alternative to the the pork belly bowl you can get at monta. It's not the same but just as good.

The ramen is oyisi!!! So delicious. I love their charsew n the egg. Cook to the perfection. 
I try 1 of their rice bowl. It was ok. It's good too. 
The price is a little pricey for me but I don't mind as long as the food is good. 
One thing that they don't have, appetizer. 
Service was ok. No complain. I'll b back.

Location: The place is located one block from Rhodes Ranch, in the same plaza with the EOS gym, right next to Cafe Rio. There are plenty of parking spaces in the back if you happen to come on a busy day. 

Decor: the restaurant is on the smaller size side. They have about 8 tables and bar. If you are in a hurry and don't have to sit at a large table,'I'd recommend to sit at the bar since you will have a better chance to sit on a busy day. All around is Japanese style ramen like in Tokyo. It's an open cooking space where you can see how they prep your meal. This is one of a good thing, you know they will be clean when someone is watching, haha. 
Simple artistic decor and oh, the bathroom is clean. 

Menu/ ingredients: once you walked into the restaurant, there is a noodle maker machine on side. All of their noodles are handmade at the location. With the exception of Tsukeme style ramen (soup on the side) which what I usually order since I believe those are ready to cook ones. It's probably due to different process required when it comes to yellow noodle. Tsukemen is more chewy compared to regular ramen noodle. I also ordered their house fried rice, very tasty and has pork belly in it! Yummm. Must try! 

Service: Their service is always good and fast. They always make sure the have enough employees to cover all tables. But I can see the space is a challenge especially when it's super busy and they are trying to bus table and then deliver soups in that small hallway. 

Price: a little higher compared to Monta in Chinatown. Portion is bigger though. And only mushroom, bamboo shoot, 2 slices of pork and green onion are included. Everything else are extras. 

RecommendAtion: Tsukemen is my favorite! Love hpw you can adjust your spicy level and add extra toppings. I would recommend to include some of the extras. Eggs should be included in the price since one bowl is already $9-10. 

Overall, I am satisfied and will be back. If they include more extra items in the price, then I will be back more often.

Love this place and the flavor. Very simple menu items which is fine with me. Very small dining area but the wait isn't surprisingly long. Good staff but my only concern is that I wished they would sanitize the tables after each party leaves. I saw them just wipe it down with a wet rag which was probably used for the table prior and the table before that. Tons of bacteria on that rag probably....Yuck...other than that the food is great.

yum ! This is medium spicy tonkatsu with nori chashu pork and soft boiled egg - the meat and egg comes cold so you do need to wait while you dip the food in the broth for it all it to consummate and get an even temp ;)

As a lover of ramen, this place was just yummy! The right amount of broth and ingredients. It was a bit on the salty side for me but otherwise great. Keep in mind their spice levels are on the high side when ordering.

Ramen Kobo is one of my favorites if not my favorite place to eat Ramen in Las Vegas. Mainly due to the fact that their noodles are made fresh in house daily. I generally sit at the bar where I can watch the cooks whip up Fresh batch for me. They do serve beer too. No complaints !

I ordered the Shoyu Ramen in chicken broth, mild but surprised to see the soup reddish and had chili flakes Tasting just the soup, I would say it's more of a medium than mild which I don't mind but I intended to share with someone who does not like spicy food. The basic toppings consist of chashu pork, 1 whole clove fried garlic, kikurage black mushrooms, bamboo shoots, green chives, moyashi (bean sprouts), ground pork and shredded red pepper (thats where the chili flakes came from). Other choices are Tonkatsu Ramen (pork broth), Miso Ramen (pork & chicken broth) and Vege Ramen in vegetable broth/toppings. 

The toppings, ramen noodle and the reddish colored soup all tasted awesome. Full of flavor but not salty. The noodle is how I expected a homemade noddle would be. I would definitely come back and try the other toppings and soup types. 

After looking at the photo of the menu more carefully, it looks like there are 5 choices (original, mild, medium, hot & fire) not 4 as I originally thought  I should've ordered the original.

My wife and daughter came here on a Tuesday night.  My two year old daughter was asleep in her stroller but the staff was very accommodating by making space so we had a place to sit.  My wife had the chicken and broth bowl and she really enjoyed it.  Only thing she would do differently is order an extra pork and add an egg.  I had the pork broth super spicy and it was delicious!  I would probably add an egg as well next time.  We also shared the pork belly bowl which we highly recommend!!  Something simple yet so tasty!  Haven't really came across a bad ramen place but we'll be back for sure as it is so close to our house.

Location is always busy, and it is  small inside but they definitely deliver on food.  They have an enclosed glass area where you can see noodles being made.  This day I came in and ordered a large  pork belly bowl ( 5.75 plus tax) to go as my time was limited. This bowl was very filling although at first sight I thought it was small but I was wrong.  The combination of the rice with the saltiness of the belly pork and the small pieces of green onion were the perfect compliment.  The belly pork was cooked just right and plenty of meat was added to bowl.
Perfect for this soup weather!!! Busy; 20mins in. Always a great sign of greatness!!! So yummy the fresh noodles!!!

I've been here several times now, so I feel like it's time to review it. I love that they are open a little later than other restaurants in the area and honestly being down the street from me helps. If this place was 10 minutes further away would I have gone so often? Honestly no. The noodles and broth are above average but not amazing. I love spicy food, but "fire" varies each time I go. For example, I've had it where I would rate it a medium all the way to fire. I thought that it was just me, but another party asked the same thing one night. They were told that it depends on the peppers. All of the staff is very friendly. I love the concentrated menu, but not serving gyoza is odd to me. (Not that I'm a ramen expert, but it seems to be standard at most other places.)

My biggest concern right now is that they don't seem to balance to go orders and in house orders well. Today, I got there during a to go rush, so I waited 25 minutes for my soup. Most of the time it is around 10-15 minutes. My guest said that it may have been the time of day, but I watched 13 to go soups go in a row before ours was made. After I heard to go orders asking if theirs was done yet because it was past their quoted time. They had been working on in house orders to catch up. Now, they are much busier. I am curious if they will keep up with the demand.
Delicious ramen! hope theh just have bigger space to accommodate and not waiting that long! Love their KimiFriedRice!

More of a 3.5 star, would I eat here again? Most likely because of the location. Is there better places in Vegas? Definitely! I do like how the noodles are made fresh, and this restaurant actually has AC unlike some ramen spots.

Hand made noodles on the west side!! I want to come back during the day as you can see right into the kitchen where they make the noodles. Simple menu and limited offerings are off set by speed and tastiness. Decor is very fitting and the 28 seats seem limited until you realize the turn time is about 20 minutes. Tried miso spicy with spinach and soy soy cured egg add-on's and a vegetable ramen with black garlic oil. Both were very flavorful and the medium spicy was just enough to get your nose running by the end of it. Service was very fast and courteous. For $8.95 a medium sized bowl of tasty ramen is a great deal. Definitely coming back.

I had "real" ramen for the first time here and I'm glad I made the choice to come here! More recently, I came here for the second time. I actually came with one of my friends both times, who is actually a regular. He said that he came to this place so often, that one of the waitresses remember his order. I ordered the pork and chicken ramen (I don't remember the proper name) both times and I loved it equally both times. The ramen here is made fresh daily so there's definitely a difference compared to packet ramen (duh). I also love how this location is so close to home compared to the other ramen places in Las Vegas. The only factor I don't like about this place is how crowded and cramped it is, but that's not something they can really change. The food is definitely worth it, though! This place will always be my first option when it comes to ramen.

I heard that this ramen shop was connected to monta so I had to try it.

The venue is nice and cozy. Our server was nice and she came to refill our waters without us having to ask. 

My girlfriend and I both got the tonkotsu ramen with an egg. It was completely different from monta though. This bowl came with ONE piece of pork and some type of ground beef?? It was really awkward. 

Probably gonna just stick with monta. Oh we both got food poisoning too. Just a heads up

Favorite ramen spot! Beats jinya for sure! They greet you when you walk in and the best part is the house made noodles and you can see them making them as you walk in! The offer a basic variety of vegetarian, chicken, and pork broths. The add-ins are awesome! I always get chicken broth with extra mushroom, butter, and can't forget the egg. Medium spicy is perfect for me. Definitely my go-to!

I've only been to a couple of ramen/noodle houses here in Las Vegas. They all fail compared to this place. I've been here twice this week, and probably a total of 15 times in the last 6 months. The staff is so friendly, and you can actual watch them make the noodles. I think we found this place by accident. Best accident ever. The prices are great! I always get the same thing because, well, if it ain't broke, don't fix it. I definitely suggest checking this place out. It's small, so expect a wait if you're coming during peak times, but again, definitely worth the wait!

I love ramen kobo!  Their broth is light n fresh, no added MSG (just what's on the soy sauce)!  Their noodles are fresh, made in front of the restaurant.  They cook with quality ingredients which is a big plus for me.  The place is small and their always busy, but it's worth the wait!

Definitely some of the best ramen I've ever had! They are true to their heat scale, unlike a lot of Asian cuisine I've had, I ordered hot for the ramen and wow it is very hot! Lol definitely will go with the medium next time but again great ramen!! Wasn't greeted right away at the door but that's ok the food was great! Come try it out!
Loved this place! I have not been impressed with the ramen places I've tried but this one knocked it out of the park!

If you love ramen this is the place to come to! Awesome and friendly staff and excellent service . I'm forsure coming back to place again! They make their own noodles and the soup is just phenomenal! Well done you guys well defiantly see me again
Chinese burrito, sechwan beef ,fish noodles all were very delicious. Sometimes a little wait because restaurant small but worth the wait.

Standard ramen, had nothing special. They had fast service, the menu is simple, perfect size portions. Not too much and not too little. 
I did like the full pieces of roasted garlic! 

The miso(pork & chicken) broth was good but the shoyu(chicken) was extremely oily, too oily. 

Downfall was they did not have seasoned eggs, which is personally one of my favorites when we go to ramen. 
Also I subbed out the red peppers and bean sprouts for corn but they still charged me extra for the corn.... 

Prob won't be coming back because my fiancé didn't like how oily his ramen was?

came in on opening day and had high expectations that were met.  I'm a big fan of the other restaurants associated with Ramen KoBo and they were met.  Loved the kim chi fried rice and the spiciness of the soup

Great food, great service, and the pork rice is bomb! The bouncy fresh noodles be popping and locking in my mouth. The spicy level is a bit intense, and I wish there were more appetizers. But I think starting with a simple menu is the way to go!

Everything was good but the noodles, they used a thick ramen noodles. Monta's noodle was better. Fried rice was great. Staff were friendly. We liked it because its about 5 min from our house. Convenient for us but if it's not something we want to keep going back to. Id drive the extra miles to go back to Monta
