The spicy level was pretty decent. My nose was running a little by the end. They say the low spicy level is like a 4/10, so mine was probably like a 6/10. The noodles are handmade which makes a huge difference. The kimchi fried rice is great for a little appetizer to share with someone. 

I'll definitely be back soon!

I like Ramen Kobo. The fact that I don't have to drive another 10 minutes to get decent ramen is also a bonus. Parking can be iffy, but it was well worth it to me. I've been able to eat there and order take out. For the most part everything is good, sometimes the broth is bland but other than that I do enjoy it.  I also like that that there is ground pork and not just the fatty pork slices. Adding spice is definitely another plus...but you know this girl can't handle too spicy anyways. Most of my friends are able to handle the spicy though and it definitely looks spicy! I definitely think the pork belly is a dish to get though. I enjoy that more than the ramen sometimes and I always order it. Overall, I'm glad that it's opened near me and the bathroom is pretty nifty.

Fresh noodles make a difference great texture.
Broth wasn't too salty and very flavorful!
No heart burn, not too greaZzzzzy. Yum!

We ordered the shoyu ramen, tonkatsu ramen, fried rice, pork belly bowl and the chashu bowl.
Excellent service. 
I have never seen chives in ramen at any place in Japan or Okinawa. Let's say, for me, it doesn't jive. I prefer traditional green onions and refuse to pay $1.00 extra for it. The fried rice was okay. The ramen bowls were good. The pork belly and the chashu lacked flavor and did not wow me. 
Although the establishment is clean and the experience was nice especially with the excellent service, I do not agree with a lot of the yelp reviews.

Not terrible.  Not great.  Just a big eh it was okay.  If you're nearby and bored it's fine.  Otherwise if you want an experience or good eat, you tend to critique a lot of the way things are done and made here more towards the negative side.  Go elsewhere for ramen.

I had low expectations going in, but I enjoyed my ramen bowls. I think it at least tastes better than Monta ramen. And since there are no ramen places on this side of town, beggars can't be choosers, right?

I pretty much get the same ramen every time and stick with their shoyu ramen. It's not overly fatty, but not super clean either. I like that it's simple. No need to choose noodles, and make things complicated. 

Service is quite good. And they move fast from seating to exit.  

Rating:  3.5 stars.

Located in Henderson, Ramen Kobo, a popular Ramen shop. offers the lovable flavors Shoyu, Tonkotsu, Tonkotsu-Shoyu, and Miso Broth.  They also have the option for a Veggie Ramen.  Instead of a normal Chashu (Pork) you receive Beansprouts, Spinach, and etc in your Ramen.

I ordered Tonkotsu Ramen and added my usual Nitamago (2 egg/which is just an egg cut in half) and Nori (Seaweed).  The first time I went, the Noodles was nice and soft, the broth goes nicely with the noodles; but, it was thick almost like watery gravy. The second time I went, which is most recent; the broth was a nice flavor and wasn't thick, but just right. 

The first time I went, they had ground meat as one of the toppings on my Ramen.  The second time I went, they had the usual piece of meat like other Ramen shops. Also at Ramen Kobo, you can choose the level of spiciness for your ramen.  The room was quite small, so if you go in a large group it might take a while to be seated, but it was a fun experience.

There's a window near the entrance where you can watch them make the noodles, they call it the Noodle Factory.  The staff was really nice and helpful when I went.  It had a nice atmosphere to visit with friends and family.

I have to say you must try this place, the best noodles I've had, they make everything from scratch and super fresh. It is just a small restaurant so the wait time could go over 20 minutes depending on how busy they are, but it is worth it, they serve you freshly cooked dishes and they are full of flavors. Tried the fried rice with no pork and it came out just perfect!!! Very fast at serving your food, so you'll be out of there in less than an hour!! I will definitely go back there for more noodles

Pretty (though tiny) nice! I'm a vegetarian and they have one vegetarian ramen noodles dish. It was nice, I'm just not sure how much more than nice, I was lacking some flavor - felt like it was somewhat flat and could have been tastier. Other than that, the place was packed, good service and a good vibe overall.

Stupid STUPID good! So fresh and spicy and delicious it's even better than jinya. YES, BETTER THAN JINYA. Why it took me so long to try kobo I do not know and regret greatly.  Best thing on the menu: miso ramen, hot, add black garlic oil, spinach, corn, egg, and extra noodles (which is an absolute MUST). Hold the scallions and bean sprouts. Thank me later. But really, killer noodles. And you can watch them being made by hand. I haven't had table service so I don't know how it is but If their to go is this good, I can't imagine how it is in house.
Great Ramen made fresh every day! We go here weekly and we love everything, healthy, broth is flavorful and perfect spice level. Friendly and great take out orders too!

This has got to be the best ramen place in Vegas! The noodles here are hand pulled and fresh. The broth is flavorful and the added veggies are perfect with the soup. This is the only place that has the word "spicy" done right. We are always in search for really spicy ramen, but the other ramen places that claim their noodles are spicy just have like chili flakes for you to add on. Not ramen kobo; their "fire" spicy level is no joke, especially for the shoyu ramen. I like that although it is extremely spicy, the spiciness is not too overwhelming that you can't taste the flavor! Beware when you order the spicy level! If you're unsure whether you can handle the spiciness, you can always ask them to have the spice on the side so you can slowly add it in. All in all, my bf and I have been coming here at least once a week for the past half year and we will continue to go here to get our weekly fix of authentic spicy ramen!

I found this place quite disappointing considering it was to be a sister to Monta ramen. The noodles were not at the same consistency as Monta and the toppings were all right. I felt like the noodles were like frozen. The only thing that tasted good was the broth. 

If you go down the street you can try Oh Jah and there noodles are definitely better lol.

Oh wow. I'm in tears and my face is red. I had the Miso Ramen with Fire heat, and they are not lying. I've been to many ramen joints all of town who claim that they have spicy noodles, some even offer you a scale. But the highest portion of the scale is never actually spicy. I don't even have the highest spice tolerance, but most places just don't it. The next time I come here, I'll probably just order it hot. Unless I'm hungover and miserable of course because fire at this place would be the perfect cure.

The noodles were pretty damn awesome. They make them in house, and you can even watch them make them in a machine that's windowed off at the front. Sadly, our set of noodles in our ramen were overlooked, but the batch of extra noodles were al dente and had a great spongy quality. I'm going to give them the benefit of the doubt on the original set. Hopefully, it was a fluke.

The broth was fantastic. Along with the aforementioned spice, it was packed with flavor and all around excellent.

My partner even had the vegetable broth, and I usually dislike those greatly. Jinya has been the only place in town with decent vegetable broth. However, this wasn't just decent. It was actually excellent. I would not mind eating it at all.

One small gripe, besides the first batch of over cooked noodles, the Asahi mugs are tiny. They're worth the price, but they just feel tiny like I'm not actually getting a full beer. The ounces might be there, but they seem and feel small.

Can't wait to come back.

Great Ramen with fresh made noodles made right in house. The pork fried rice...lets just say I always order one to eat there and another one to take home, yes it's that Delicious! The only thing that was disappointing was that they don't have gyoza (potstickers) like they do at Monta (their sister restaurant) or other ramen places.  
I had the Miso Ramen, medium heat level with extra chashu pork and added corn and green onion. It was so good. Their ramen comes standard with the sliced black mushrooms so I asked them to not put it in my bowl. I live across town but it was worth the drive and have gone back 3x total now.

I love the miso (pork/chicken broth combo)! I order this without spice because I like the pure taste of the broth. The noodles are delicious so **TIP** request extra noodle if you're extra hungry. It's only $1.50! Additional add-ins can get pricey, but I suggest adding nori and corn.

The seating area is small with a few tables and bar-like seating along the kitchen. I would only recommend groups of 2-4 to dine here.

I took my gf here on her lunch break. We got there right as they opened at 1130 AM. Only 1 other customer was there.

I wanted to sit next to my gf on the booth side of the table instead of the hard chair

Our server Rachel, the Japanese girl w/ blonde hair, wouldn't let us sit where we wanted saying the tables are for parties of 4 (there were 2 of these tables)

She told us to sit at the bar if we wanted to sit next to each other

Not gonna comment on the food because I already had a bad taste in my mouth

Horrible customer service!!! Go to Monta instead

Have been here a few times, and I have to say it's just good. There are better options, in my opinion, like Ramen Sora, but it's really close to home when I don't feel like driving to Chinatown.

It's a little disappointing that they don't have gyoza as an option. I ate the tonkotsu ramen medium spicy. The first time I went it was almost too spicy to finish, but the other times was just enough spice. The broth has good flavor, not too light, but almost creamy. You have to add things that come already at other places, like the egg, and it only comes with one small piece of chashu pork. The noodles are made in house, and they are probably the best thing about this place. I don't recommend taking it Togo though, it doesn't hold up as well as you'd think.

Also, on the weekdays, they have a weird break in their hours where they are closed from 2:30-5.

Great ramen spot on the southwest side of town. Located in the same plaza as EOS fitness, Ramen Kobo is very conveniently located right off 215/Durango.

One of the unique quirks about this place is that you can see the ramen noodles being made right in front of you in the waiting area. Love that set up!

Yep, the ramen here is on point. I haven't had anything but ramen so I can't comment on the rest of the menu but I do enjoy all the ramen here. My favorite is the tonkotsu. Unlike some other ramen places, the broth is flavorful yet not too strong or heavy in the sodium taste. 

Service has been great from my experiences. The restaurant is pretty small so don't feel odd if you sit close to the table next to you - it may happen especially when the place gets busy. They have a bar area available along with some tables.

One thing I do dislike about this place: add-ons prices. Most other ramen places I've been to include an egg free of charge. Here it is $1 or something. It's also $1 to add seaweed they provide one piece. 

Still not too bad for a bowl of ramen. It's about $8 and change for a bowl without any additional items. I do come here frequently, mostly because of its convenient location though.
This place was amazing warning it is crowded . I got the chicken broth but I added black garlic oil soooo good !! I can't wait to go back

Probably OVERALL the BEST Ramen place in town.
Noodles have great flavor and the choices are perfect with sides to compliment your ramen. 
Basic Tonkatsu extra noodles is simple yet satisfying enough to make you want more the next week. 
We still enjoy other places (Jinya, Sora, Fukumimi, Tatsu, Monta, Kokoro, Moko) but this is the one I would recommend to anyone wanting or even craving a solid bowl of tasty Ramen being their first or hundred time.
Service is second to non, food and sides come out like there's no tomorrow, fast and hot!
Very courteous and a sense of urgency every time we come here. 
Workers set the standard for service for me and the only drawback is the hit and miss waiting time, but that's always a good thing because everyone knows this is the Best Ramen on the whole west side of Vegas.

The ramen noodles here were good. Great texture. The broth however, was a bit rich, heavy, & somewhat busy. I ordered the miso broth with medium spice & added an egg & mustard greens. It was decent. My husband had the tonkatsu broth with medium spice & added Kim chi which was served on the side. This place was just ok for us. We still prefer Monta ramen over this place.
the miso soup is spicy and is amazing!  I highly recommend it.

A buddy  took me here for lunch the other day and it did not disappoint, has to be one of the best ramen spots in town.  Was told that Ramen KoBo has the same owners of Monta so if your a fan of that place (which I am!) you should also like KoBo. They make their noodles in house which are nice and thick and they also offer you a spice level which you don't get that option at Monta. From the broth to the meat and fixens, it was a really good meal. Place is small but they do a great job of getting people in and out, no complaints.

Pretty good place. I'm not too familiar with food like this. So I can't just give it 1 star because I don't like the food. Overall good experience, it's kinda hard to know what to order if it's your first time. Also, it's a little pricey can't lie. 

I got like noodles with some chicken in it. It was ok, nothing crazy. As I stated I'm not used to eating this type of food. I also got the hottest flavor! Bad choice wayyy to hot lol. I would check it out if you in the area.

One of my favorite Ramen places in Vegas. Great food, fast and friendly service, but the eating area is pretty small so rush hour has a bit of a wait. Over all I would with out a doubt recommend this to anyone as It is in a convenient area of Summerlin and good price.

Very good Ramen! They were delicious, fresh, and fast. The fried rice is unreal!!!!!! I only wish they had more veggies you could add but other wise the menu is straight to the point and easy to read! Yum!!!

I really enjoyed this spot. They make their noodles fresh in house. I went with the pork broth ramen. No extras, just straight up. At first the porkiness of the broth us a little overwhelming,  but once it settles it's delicuous. All ingredients used were really good. Oh and I went with mild spicy, which just barely hits your throat here and there. Good stuff, not pricey.  But don't go, it's small, and you will just cause me to wait in line longer next time I go lol.
Very delicious experience! There was a wait on a Sunday evening but nothing too lengthy and it was worth the wait. The made-in-house noodles were a kewl touch! We'll definitely be back

This place is super delicious, and I would recommend it. I ordered the miso ramen and added an egg and nori to it. I wish it showed the Bonito flakes on the menu instead of a separate advertisement or I would have added that too. 

My friend and I were a bit confused from the placement of the bean sprouts. It took us almost the entire meal to figure out that the bean sprouts are actually placed beneath the noodles. The spice levels are indeed true to their description. We were here in the late afternoon for an early dinner. We were attended to quickly and we had a very kind server. When asked to split the check, even though I forgot to ask at the beginning, he helped us very quickly. I believe we were in and out in half an hour. This is a great fast casual establishment. I would definitely come here again!
Love this ramen place! And they make the noodles in front of the store!! Be careful though, their "mild is still a bit spicy so I usually order it on the side

The West side finally has Vegan ramen!! 

It's a small place, so your going to wait a bit at peak times. The veggie ramen was excellent and the prices are very reasonable. I ordered the "fire spicy" and it was hot! I might go down a notch on the spicy meter on my next visit.
Average, fast and good for the money. This place has an atmosphere of China Town after-party diner with EDM playing in the background, but is favored by families living in the neighborhood.

This was my first ramen experience here in Las Vegas. It's pretty close spaced inside with a single walk through between a row of table seatings on the left and bar seating on the right. The menu is simple. Service is brief & straightforward yet accommodating. Not the friendliest crew I've seen yet not hostile either. Our server was attentive despite the busy hours. 

Itadakimasu!! (..did i spell that right?!) My tonkatsu ramen on medium spice which I ordered with corn, egg, and butter was delicious. Reasonably spicy. Their kimchi fried rice wasn't that spicy and it had a dried fish flavor to it rather than kimchi. I did like it. At the end we all left with satisfied stomachs. I recommend. 

Just don't be offended if the servers don't smile at you.

I have been going to ramen kobo for almost a year now and it's the only ramen place in town that has homemade noodles and their broth is always so good especially if you like spicy  I love this place. I don't even live close to it and I go at least once or twice a month it is so good  I would recommend 10/10 especially because I've been too a lot of ramen places in Vegas and nobody tops this place

I really wanted to love this place, especially since it's literally down the road from my house. The broth just isn't as flavorful as other ramen places. The noodles are just alright. Nothing really caught my attention. Perhaps on my next visit I shall try other items on the menu.

Introducing a brand new west side ramen house are the creators of Monta Ramen. Monta being the last review I wrote I was a bit excited, sort of, to see if this would be any different. To my satisfaction it truly was a delightful experience.
It's in a plaza off of Durango not very far from the brand new Ikea store that was built. True to form , it was busy with people waiting, and a list for you to put your name on, but that's pretty standard in every Ramen House; at least any worth dining at.
 An Original side note from anywhere else; they are also a noodle-making factory. As you wait in the front when you sign in, you can look through the glass and watch the gentleman/his machine and lots of fresh noodles.
The restaurant was very clean, with everything open on display, so you'd be able to tell exactly how organized and clean they really are. Even the bathrooms, that's right,  it gets five stars across the board.
As always I ordered a medium Spicy Miso Ramen with nothing extra so I could give you a review on exactly how it tasted as it came. All I can tell you in one word is DELICIOUS!!!! I enjoyed the broth much more than I did before and the fusion of flavors was very palatable.
Just like Monta I love their Kimchi Fried Rice , but it was much milder than I expected.  
My boyfriend and I shared the pork bowl which is always a favorite for us. Kobo's pork belly was lighter is color, just like if you were to prepare it at home. Where as what I'm used to, it is darker brown like a barbecue type pork, regardless it was very very good.
Ramen Kobo is definitely not bland in flavor, as all of their spices mesh into a delightful symphony in your mouth. Begging you to sing another song. It's a very Quaint restaurant, though I've never been to a large one. Size didn't take away from their character, as all of their friendly staff, made it so pleasant to dine there. I truly enjoyed the food and they experience and I would definitely rate it higher than Monta Ramen. 
I vote five stars for Ramen Kobo and thank them for such a wonderful dining experience. It's my pleasure to recommend Kobo's to anyone on the west side and even if you're not, you won't be disappointed....

Ooooh this place was so good! I love how simple the menu was. Easy and fast ordering. We sat on the bar where you can see the cooks making yummy ramen. I loved the energy in this place it was awesome. I ordered a mild miso ramen. Loved the spice of the miso broth & the noodles were the star of the dish. From the front of the restaurant you can see the noodles actually being made! You will like this place if you want a good hardy bowl of ramen.
Delicious!! Kimchi fried rice is awesome too. We got our ramen at medium heat with extra pork - it was perfect. Will def be back! Happy this place is close to the house!!!

I moved out to Vegas a few months ago and have been trying different ramen restaurants. Ramen KoBo is by far the tastiest one I've been to. 

FOOD: 
Any place that makes their own noodles fresh in the restaurant is already ahead of the game but the broth is what actually matters. I ordered the spicy tonkatsu ramen which comes with one slice of cha shu, ground pork, mushrooms, bamboo shoots, and bean sprouts. For an extra $1.50, I added an egg, which still blows my mind that ramen places will charge extra for that (minus 1 start for that). I'm used to the egg being included. Anyway, for spicy lovers who like the kick of chili but still want their taste buds, medium is perfect. Not only did I eat all the noodles, but also drank all the broth. 

QUALITY:
You can't beat homemade noodles. And the broth was exactly what it needed to be. I can see how some people might complain about the saltiness but flavor of the broth is still delicious. 

PRICE:
It's about $9 for a bowl of ramen and extra ingredients range from $1.50 to $3.00. They also have sides for about $5-6, and beer within the $2 range (pretty affordable)!

CUSTOMER SERVICE: 
Friendly staff. Two girls came to check on me periodically and refilled my water. 

ENVIRONMENT:
This place is somewhat tiny so I can see it getting packed during dinner hours. There is a ramen bar and dining table area. 

Overall, I will come here again whenever I'm craving ramen!

First, I'll share that I've never been to a ramen restaurant before. I'm forever eating Vietnamese, Japanese, and Thai food, but I've never been to a ramen specific restaurant until today.

Since I'm currently doing this whole plant-based lifestyle, I opted for the vegetarian bowl with vegetable broth and added black mushroom ($1) and mustard greens ($1.50). Seems a little excessive to charge $1.50 for 8 leaves of greens, but whatever, it was my choice.

My bowl came out and the first thing I noticed is that it was very oily broth. Again, I've never been to a ramen place so I have no idea if that's normal or not...but I wasn't stoked about it. The dish was delicious, I ordered level 3/4 for spiciness and that was perfect for me. The noodles were excellent, the flavors were fantastic, but I wish it had been less oily. I went from feeling healthy about my choice to feeling like I need to do some extra cardio this afternoon. 

One other note - the vegetable bowl was the only option for vegetarians/vegans. All the rice dishes have meat and/or egg in them. This isn't a huge deal because the main dishes are the ramen, but just a heads up if you are a plant-based eater.

Order Miso Ramen, Extra Chashu, and Nitamago and to go Fried Rice nothing great on the Ramen. Chashu cook different way kinda meaty on the chew not the typical tender, one that I'm used too in some other Ramen place. Only good side I find in this place? it's close to Southwest. Customer service so so find the server not really engaged on her customer maybe just maybe long day for. her.
Ramen is average at best. One thing that they could easily do better is give hot broth instead of like warm. Only go here because it's close

KoBo is my all time favorite and go to spot for ramen. I love the simple but ramen focused menu. No, there isn't gyoza but the fresh noodles, variety in soup bases and the rice bowls make up for it. The pork belly buns are great too. 

I'm a big fan of the tonkatsu ramen and it's a plus to be able to have them put the spice on the side if you aren't sure about what your belly can handle. I always get a side of either kimchi fried rice or a pork belly bowl. They are must haves and also great if you're too lazy to pack a lunch for work the next day.

Everything is extremely reasonably priced and yes, sometimes you have to wait but it's totally worth every minute.

The service is great and the food is always delicious. I have turned many friends onto KoBo and many have turned it into their go-to ramen spot. Definitely a big fan of KoBo and they never disappoint!
The food is amazing and the service is super quick. My only minor complaint would be that the music gets loud, but I think I'm just old, lol. Other than that the place is phenomenal.

Like every local, I was ecstatic to hear that Monta Ramen would be opening another location in the Southwest which is rapidly growing with great restaurants. When Omoide opened, they lived up to the hype. After all, it was one of the first ramen spots to open in Southwest. And so when word came on the street that Monta (who made it on Travel Channel) decided to expand its location, it was over. My life was complete.

And how disappointed I was.
Came here twice, about 3 weeks apart which was enough to say that I would not be coming back. Actually, should not have even come the second time. 
On a non-busy weekday, I stood by the seating area for 10 minutes. Tables and bar area non filled. Host/Server did not actually even acknowledge me and had her head working on some check by the computer. It was not until 2 guys walked in that she looked up and saw us and thought we were together as one party. 

I ordered the Tonkotsu Shoyu Ramen. This time, I thought, I would be smart and just order extra Chashu since the first time there was only one fatty piece. Kobo is smart. Since they want you to pay for additional toppings, my logic was that if I paid for extra chashu- perhaps there would be more chance of better chashu. I paid $2.50 for 4 pieces of fat, essentially.

How is it that the SAME ramen restaurant can have two completely different chashus? Did not particularly favor the tiny portion of ground beef inside either.  Given, the noodles are made freshly in-house. Other than that, the ramen is terrible. 

I will make that drive to Jinya or Monta Ramen on the other side of town. 
But Ramen Kobo, I will pass.

10 STARS! Hands down my favorite spot to get ramen! Best quality for the price! It is however only meant for small parties of 4 or less. My girl and I come here very often either for take out or dine in. They are very polite and have excellent service. If you want to get full I suggest get any of the ramen choices your way and add extra noodles! Price are roughly around $10 per bowl of ramen and side dishes are around $5. Keep it up Ramen KoBo!!! We'll always be back!

Great food! Great Price! Excellent customer service!
Parking: lots
Interior: small, clean, bar is good to eat on spacious. You can watch them make fresh noodles while you wait. And they all use gloves. 

You can watch them prep and cook your food in the bar area. 

I try and stay way from flour, gluten, but this place is great, I had to try it!! 
Thank you Mitch for a great dinner!!

This place just opened up close to me and it is now my new favorite ramen place in town! After my first time here, I was back the very next day.  It was that good.  The broth is very flavorful and the chashu meat is tender.  We always order the pork belly fried rice as an appetizer.  Definitely recommend it!  I only wish there were more seating as there is usually a wait with the limited seating.

Probably more of a 3.5 star rating, I'm a fan of Kobo's noodles and broths, but the sometimes cold (and stingy) chashu and nitamago can really dampen the experience.

My understanding is that Ramen Kobo is somehow affiliated with Monta Ramen, being opened by the same team of people.  Although Monta was one of the original ramen spots in Vegas, I stopped going because I wasn't a fan of their thin noodles or their super salty broths.  Both of those things are fixed for me at Ramen Kobo, where you can see them make their thick, chewy noodles and add in some spice to your tonkotsu, shoyu, miso, or vege broths.  My favorite has been the miso ramen with mild spicyness, which seems to prove that I'm a big wuss when it comes to spice...anything higher than mild and I'm quite sure I won't be enjoying my ramen.

The few things that I'm not a fan of are sort of big things when it comes to a good bowl of ramen.  By default, a bowl only comes with one slice of chashu.  You can add more for $2.50, but then that turns your $8.95 bowl of ramen into an $11.45 bowl of ramen.  Also by default, your bowl does not come with any egg, but you can add one nitamago for $1.50, turning your already $11.45 bowl of ramen into a $12.95 bowl of ramen.  These things might seem nitpicky because I'm choosing to add these ingredients, but other shops in town offer these things for $7-$10 by default, no need to add them.  There have also been several times where the added chashu and egg are cold, as if they came straight from the refrigerator and were tossed on top of my ramen right before being served; no bueno.

Overall an upgrade from the original Monta Ramen, as well as a decent ramen spot in a part of town that didn't have any ramen spots before.

Well the first thing that greets you when you walk in, besides the wait stools built for the Oompa Loompas, is the lady in the enclosed glass area making fresh ramen. This is a very authentic Japanese ramen place where the servers are Japanese and the cooks are Mexican. Of course. 

But the ramen is very good. Service is prompt and the food comes out fast. So you are pretty much done before they can wish you thank you and don't let the door hit your arse on the way out, because you will always have to wait a good 15-30 min when you come eat. That's how busy they are!

Great home made noodles, especially on cold Vegas nights. Only things I can really complain about is the space. It's a very small restaurant with limited seating, which causes waiting times to increase. That tells you even though it is small, it's high quality noodles. So if you are not in a hurry, check it out. 
The staff is friendly, noodles are made fresh. Only things you need to worry about is picking what broth you want and what spice level suits you. I'm a fan of spicy, but I haven't gone past mild at this spot, maybe one day.
Fire Tonkotsu Ramen is on point. Noodles are handmade and its amazing! Definitely my #1 choice for ramen on the southwest side.

Monta's sister company.  Larger kitchen, same inconvenient / lack of seating.  Parking is also a nightmare here so this is an authentic replication of the Monta's experience with a slightly less delicious broth.

Best Ramen in the summerlin area. Only thing is that their restaurant is tiny and if there are a lot of people, it gets super packed. The food quality is incredible tho. I've been to Japan , in some real ramen joints, and Kobo is close! The customer service is also great. They do their best to get you seated asap.

Food is still good, but they're getting stingy. I usually order the kiddo a side of noodles $1.50 and a side of shoyu broth $2.00 (he likes it basic) and there's no issue. Fast forward a few weeks and apparently "they can't do that". Now what they CAN do is Shoyu Ramen with no toppings, which is the same price as with ALL the toppings, which is $8.95.

It's still yummy, I just don't like the trend of price hiking once a restaurant becomes established.. Don't get me wrong, I'm not cheap, I add about $6-7 worth of upgrades to my ramen alone but come on.

I have been there a handful of times and it's pretty good. The staff is always friendly and very quick with bringing out your order. This is located in the same plaza as the EOS Fitness on Durango. 

I usually get the chicken ramen and that never fails to satisfy. It's always really packed at lunch so try to avoid rush hours. Also, if you do come solo or with one other, the bar is always a great option to dine at. 


My kids always get the fried rice! They can eat that rice for days! Other than the basic ramen and fried rice, I haven't explored the menu too much because I'm usually here for a post workout meal or a quick bite before work. Plus, I can't lie I do have a few other top ramen spots in I prefer. For being in the southwest part of town, it definitely does the job!

Holy yum!! I love ramen and went to Vegas to visit my sister (also a ramen fanatic). She took me here and right away I loved the atmosphere and direct view of their house made noodle set up! It's small but trust me, you want to wait. I ordered the spicy broth (hot) and should have done the hottest one because I love spice. The broth was so good and flavorful. In addition they had options for additions and side sauces like minced garlic, pickled ginger (my sisters favorite), and chili oil. You can do so much with their options and the soft boiled egg is always an excellent addition. Their noodles were the perfect texture. Overall this is definitely a must-eat-eatery.

Best ramen in town! The first day I went here I was amazed & then I came back the next 3 days in a row because I craved it. Having been to Japan, this place has very authentic Japanese service; warm welcomes, prompt service, genuine care & a sincere want for you to come back again. 

I love that the ramen noodle are made fresh. You can actually watch them make the noodles through a glass window towards the front door. The bowls are huge & under $10, unless you want extra toppings but the original bowls come with a lot in them. From original to hot, the flavors are exceptional & you have to order their pork chashu buns...to die for! 

Definitely try this restaurant! You won't be disappointed. Expect a little bit of a wait if you're going for dinner though but it's worth it. You

A sister shop of Monta. They serve a variety of ramen (they have a noodle machine in the shop) and many other common items that you may find at a typical ramen shop such as Kimchi fry rice, pork belly bowl, etc.. The ramen is not as strong/flavorful as Monta but still very good. If you like ramen but feel Monta is too strong/oily/salty to your taste, you will most likely love this place.

Ramen KoBo executes ramen very well, but the lack of toppings on the preset ramen combinations prevent this place from reaching 5 stars.

The restaurant is fairly small, so don't bring giant groups to this place or else you'll have to wait awhile. Also, just a note: they only seat full parties and the waiting area is always pretty cramped. But my wait was actually fairly quick, considering we had a party of 8. Our waiter was friendly; he was also efficient as he got our waters right away and he took our orders without hesitation. 

I ended up getting a mild Miso Ramen. I'll let you know right now, this was not mild. I'm usually good with spice/spices, but this place was a little too much for me. I would recommend choosing a spiciness level one below you think if you're like me and THINK you can handle spiciness. Even though the ramen was a bit too spicy, I could still taste the depth and flavor of the ramen. It was salty, smooth, and everything I could ask for in a ramen broth. 

The noodles were the best part of the dish though. Handmade right in the restaurant, the noodles were long and cooked to perfection. Other places tend to overcook the noodles, making them limp and soggy, but not this place. Since they were cut bigger than usual, they had a good bite to it, and they absorbed the flavors of the broth very well. 

The preset combination disappointed me though. It had the typical ingredients: chashu pork, fried garlic, black mushrooms, chives, ground pork, bamboo shoots, sesame oil, and shredded red pepper. But my problem was that it wasn't enough. And if you want to add extra ingredients, go for it! But expect to pay upwards of $15 to $20 for your ramen. That's a little steep for ramen if you ask me.

Overall, this place is great. From the fresh handmade noodles to the flavorful broth, Ramen Kobo knows ramen and knows it well. Just be warned that the ramen is SPICY and the extra ingredients will definitely rack up your bill!

Walked in on a busy Friday night. Opted to order to go. They have a tablet set up for take out orders which made it very quick and convenient. Ramen was delish. 

Place is small, but very clean. No frills, straight to the point ramen joint. Will be returning again in hopes of dining in.

Soy heaven.  I'm allergic to soy, but my husband was craving this like crazy.... We went 4 times in one week..... it wasn't fun for me.  We got lucky we didn't have to wait too long all 4 times.  The first few times we came here, we had to wait at least 30 minutes.

You know when it's a good spot when their menu is only a few items on it.  The best part of coming here is for their fresh noodles made in house.  The texture of the noodle and rich flavor of the broth is so good.  

I would order the Miso Ramen, mild(it's pretty hot already), nitamago, and black garlic oil.  

I tried this original level(no spicy) it's ok.... it's better with mild in my opinion.

This is by far the best ramen I have had in Vegas. Yes, better than jinya. They make their noodles fresh in house and there is a glass panel where you can watch, which is a nice touch. The space is small but cute, kind of reminds me of a restaurant you'd see in New York. I don't know how to explain why it's good other than it just tastes better ?. My only complaint is I wish it was open later.
Best ramen in the SW. Their pork belly bowls are my fav  good service. usually little to no wait.

Not my first time here but I must say my second time around was very disappointing. 
I decided to take my family here since they love ramen and this place was really good.
Walked in and got seated within 5 minutes. 
We all ordered the same thing the tonkatsu ramen.
When it came mine had no pork in it. I kindly asked the waiter named Rachel and she then proceeded to the kitchen. She then told her other coworker which he rolled his eyes. Hey not my mistake it was theirs. She brings it and I was kind of surprised because it was only a single thin slice. I guess I'm use to other ramen places where they put 2. My sister made a remark " oh so small". The waitress over heard and came to our table saying 
" only comes with 1 piece" weird because she was eavesdropping.
I also forgot to tell them no veggies in mine or my sister's. But that was my mistake. No problem so I picked them out. The same waitress proceeded to our table once again and said " next time order no veggies so you're not picking everything out" in a very rude manner. 
Is she out of her mind? Talking to a customer like that. I work in customer and food. I wouldn't dare talk like that. We were all pretty taken back by her rude comments. Her and her coworker would not stop dogging our table and talking about us.
Clearly In a different language (Chinese) 
The whole time my family felt uncomfortable. Not to mention they never checked up on us once.  She was also arguing with the chefs in the kitchen. Not only could we hear her but other customers turned their attention to them. 
Sigh, this place has really good ramen. Not sure if we'll be back though. To sum everything up 
Great food, shitty service!

Service was great, food was great, bathrooms were super clean. The waitress Angel was super nice! The whole staff is very welcoming actually. 5/5, there is a bit of a wait sometimes but that's only because the Ramen/anything in the menu IS DELICIOUS  P.S. TAIWON IS THE BEST & DESERVES SO MUCH APPRECIATION !

Came here with my husband over the weekend on our short trip to Vegas.

We were excited to find out Monta opened a Spicy concept restaurant, and I loooovvvveee spicy ramen!!!!

When we arrived, they were making hand made noodles inside the store, which was cool to watch.
Fresh and firm noodles are the best.

I wish we had a spicy concept ramen joint in Orange County too...

Thank you Ramen Kobo!

I'm giving them a 4 because it really is a nice place, but I'm not into spicy ramen.  So I won't be back.  That being said all the food was fresh and flavorful.  It was cool to see the broth/stock being simmered right in front of you.  Downside was my waitress was a bit flakey. When I sat down at first she asked what I wanted to drink.  In a unique restaurant I want to see if they have any unique drinks so I said I needed to take a look at the menu first.  She hovered around for an oddly long amount of time.  Then at the end I had to ask for my check twice.  And no, they weren't that busy.
Nice to have a ramen location at the southwest so you don't have to drive to Chinatown area.

This place is horrible..the miso ramen tasted  like dishwashing sponge juice. The pork belly bowl was also disgusting and what a waste of money. the service was none cause the waiter was in a rush to hear or even care about the food they are serving their customers. Why is this place a 4star?!!

I enjoyed this place for Ramen and would be sure to come back. First to get the vegan review out of the way...

1.  They have a vegan ramen that the daughter states is out of this world.  I also tasted it and the broth was fantastic. I find it hard to get a really good broth for a vegan or vegetarian style ramen, however, this was excellent.

2.  Besides the vegan choice, we had a Shoyu Ramen and a tonkatsu ramen.  I had extra mustard greens with my Shoyu Ramen and also had it original.

3.  The noodles were excellent and homemade and fresh.  The broth, was very delicate with bits of oil floating from the bone broth and from the chashu pork that was in the ramen.  The pork was very tender and fall apart moist.  Loved it.  The noodles themselves were firm and had a great texture.  Perfect amount of vegetables to round out this tasty ramen.

I will be back to try more spicier versions of their dishes.  I wanted to be able to taste the broth without be hidden by the spices.

Good quick service, hot soup and tasty food.

GK says, check it out. Just be careful, it is a fairly small restaurant.

Place is kind of small, only have five tables on your left side, right side are rows of bar stools, on your right side when you walk in, there's a small room you can see the guy making noodles, we got the miso ramen, noodles are thin and chewy, soup base is light and tasty, service is on par... if you want light and tasty lunch, this is the place..

I loved the restaurant and the friendly staff. I took my order to go. I wasn't a fan of the ramen but that may just be my palette. I ordered mild and it was a good spicy. I also put the Chatsu Chicken on it and loved it. .The fried rice is excellent.

This place is by far the best ramen shop in town. Their broth is excellent and rich in flavor. Their fresh made noodles are something you can taste the quality of. Always get your ramen with an egg and some black garlic oil you won't regret it.  Pictures are from two different times same broth Tonkatsu with Medium Spice which is the redder one and the other no spice both Black Garlic oil

We were excited to try a new place for ramen and it's closer to home. It's very small and crowded but we only waited a few minutes for a table. The service was average, not over attentive but my glass of water wasn't ever empty. The food was also average, the only thing different than some of the other places was the ability to pick the spicy level. The biggest issue I had and the reason that I will more than likely NOT go back there was the noise level. It's like they lined the walls with something to amplify the noise.  I'm fine with normal busy restaurant noise bit this was enough that I was ready to leave before the food came.

I got the "mild" ramen and I had to have additional broth added because it was too spicy to enjoy. People that like very spicy foods would probably fare better, but didn't find the items worth the price. The noodles were great and the fried rice was excellent. The service was exceptional.
There are a number of noodle houses in this area and this one, while being authentic, was a bit out of my taste range.

Ramen Kobo is one of our go to restaurants when my family is craving for ramen.  There are not many tables like a typical ramen house.  We try to go before 6 to avoid waiting for a table as we are a family of 5.  They make the noodles fresh in-house.  The kids enjoy watching the noodles being made as we wait for out table.  I usually order the miso ramen.  I like tonkatsu ramen at Monta but I prefer the miso at Ramen Kobo.  The fried rice is good but we like the fried rice at Monta slightly better.  It's in the southwest side of town where there are not many choices when it comes to ramen houses.  

If you do not want to drive to spring mountain Chinatown area and live in the southwest side of town I recommend Ramen Kobo.

Now I am no Ramen Master like my friends that travel to Japan frequently, but I know a decent bowl when presented one. This was my second trip to this location and I was happy to be back. We managed to hit it during a low time and got seated at the bar right away. I ordered the pork belly fried rice appetizer and my co-worker ordered the pork belly over rice. As other people have stated, the chow readily flows from the kitchen with great haste. Both appetizers were excellent. I could eat the fried rice everyday if given the chance. Now on to the star of the show.

My co-worker and I both ordered the medium spicy tonkatsu ramen with extra pork, extra egg, and a various assortment of veggies. The broth was the perfect level of spice and amazing creaminess. It was hot but not scorching, temperature wise. Another popular place in Vegas disappointed me with mildly tepid broth the day before. I will save that for another review. The noodles were the perfect level of chewiness and absorbed just a bit of the broth. Kobo makes their own noodles and I love them. I wish they could dry them and sell them, so I could have them at home. 

We both left fat and happy. Upon my return to Vegas, this will be the first stop.

Bomb. 
The broth was great, the noodles were great. 
Everything was great. 
It's not as packed as it is in China town, which is awesome. But you still get the authenticity of it. 
They even make their noodles in house!
Found another great Ramen House this one is right up the street from where I live. House made noodles can't go wrong. The steamed pork bun was also excellent.I will definitely be returning.
Missing corn bad service luckily another server a gentleman got my corn. The girl had blonde hair with short hair usually with two piggy tails recommend not seeing her bad service

I'll start with what I liked: I got there at 11:25am and found out that they didn't open until 11:30.  There was already a group of customers waiting outside.  When they opened (exactly at 11:30), the 8 of us waiting were seated promptly and efficiently.  Water was served, orders were taken, and everyone had food at 11:45.  Talk about fast!   I also really liked their pork chashu - it was really delicious.   That's about all that I liked. 

So the pork chashu must have been sliced by a skilled chef, it is surprisingly thin and you only get one slice with your order.  I had the miso ramen with mild (lowest) level spicy.  My order was doused in red pepper and was very spicy.  I didn't taste much of the broth because the heat overwhelmed all other flavors.  The toppings were also sparse, so it was like having noodles in a spicy soup and not much else.  I can't say I enjoyed the ramen here, which is like 90% of the entire menu.
Ramen is so great. Beware that it is a little spicy so order wisely. Also get in the mood for ramen at least once a month. Great service and food. Will always come and eat here.

This is our favorite Ramen spot in Las Vegas!! We're from LA and we tried many many ramen spots and this place would rank #2 on our list! 2 thumbs up! We always get their Tonkotsu medium spicy and their Pork belly bowl. So good. And how awesome is that they serve draft beer to devour with your ramen ugh! I'm writing this review as I'm going to to-go some right now :)

I really like this ramen place. Although the prices are slightly higher than chinatown, this place has rich broth, thick noodles and enough meat to satisfy me.   I ordered the tonkotsu ramen and really liked the flavor of the broth and texture of the noodles.  Finishing the bowl made me pretty full. 

If you don't know if you like spicy ramen or not you can always order the hot sauce on the side.

I love this place! The broth has so many dimensions and a very deep flavor. The noodles are perfect. I love the pickled ginger available to add to your ramen or that comes standard on the fabulous fried rice. The menu is simple and all items are fresh. My only complaints are that the establishment is tiny. Either get there when they open or be prepared for a wait. And also that they close for a few hours mid-day. I understand that they must make more noodles, but twice I've neglected to look at the time and shown up while they were closed.

This place was suggested by my sister. Since I've been to Monte Chaya and had a bad experience with Ramen in the past, I was kind of iffy about coming here. We were seated right away which I know it's probably golden because the restaurant is pretty small and narrow. I know the wait time could take a while if the line was long. Luckily, when we were seated, the place filled up not to long after.

Down to the food...I ordered the chicken broth ramen, mild with an extra egg. The broth is so delicious! I never had ramen like this! Everything about the bowl was heavenly. From the daily made scratch noodles, the meat, the bamboo shoots, just everything together gave the soup the perfect bite and flavor. I never cleaned my bowl like that, not even when I eat pho! Even my 5 year old who is a picky eater had a small bowl of the soup and dived right into it.

As far as the service....they are fast, friendly and attentive. They are quick to refill drinks and not to mention, we barely had any wait time waiting for our food to arrive.

I love everything about this place: The prices are affordable, food is exquisite and service is excellent! Great experience trying this Ramen place. I'll will be back AGAIN for sure!

My favorite ramen shop! Wonderful food and inexpensive. The noodles are bouncy and delicious paired with the flavorful broth is absolute perfection. Their pork belly bowl and pork fried rice are also my top picks along with the miso ramen medium is the perfect meal for me. Sometimes I also get the iced green tea which pairs perfectly with the food. I highly recommend this place! Also, their customer service is always on point!

The broth, the noodles and most of all, the excellent customer service and friendly atmosphere. They deserve all 5 stars. This has quickly become a go to place for me and my family. Although at times, the wait could be a bit longer due to the size of the place (it is a Ramen house - so don't expect it be large in size), the wait is definitely worth it!

The depth of the flavor in their soup is well defined and their Ramen is all made in house - perfectly cooked! If you are a spicy soup enthusiasts, you will want to try the "hot" level. Many toppings to choose from as well!

This place is awesome! Very small menu selection but everything was amazing! I love that all the noodles are fresh too. It kind of sucks because all the toppings are extra money... Their chashu isn't very good.. It's literally a piece of fat. The egg and nori however is amazing!

I also ordered the kimchi rice which was super delicious! One bowl of ramen was perfect for me and my friend to split and be full. 

The inside is super small, kind of like monta ramen. The staff are extremely friendly and attentive. They also kept my water full constantly which is a plus.

Great service and great ramen! :)

I love this place. Food is always so fresh and delicious. The place is a little small, so sometimes you have a long wait. However, if you have the time I thinks it's worth it. I always get miso ramen with extra pork and add in a soft boil eggs with corn. Sometime I add seaweed, but add to the side so it doesn't get soggy. It is always on point! They also make noodles in house and while waiting you can look into the noodle making room!

Love the fresh handmade noodles! Quality is always best, never had something tasted that wasnt before. Theyre pretty consistent with their recipe. Place was pretty small, could be busy at times but worth the wait!  Normally i get the tonkotsu w/ garlic oil! Broth is rich and perfect with the garlic oil! Chasu isnt your typical kind in where its 80% of it was fat. This one has more meat than fat, which i prefer. Give it a try i bet you'll like it!

Ramen Kobo has become a ritual for all my visitors and guests.  I absolutely adore the staff and the Miso Ramen.  Noodles are made fresh and if you're lucky you will be able to watch them make the noodles in front of you.

Foods great. It didn't meet my customer service expectations. The old waitress is just rude. But is nice to others. I was just keeping quiet. Said you're welcome to other people but when I said thank you she didn't say anything and just gave a fake grin.
She was smiley to my boyfriend though. But not me.

Opening day is today. Sitting at the table waiting for the ramen. So far, the menu is nicely laid out, and easy to navigate. The place is small and thin, with the small bar counter up against the kitchen like a ramen house should be. Best ramen houses are holes in the wall. This is just a nicely interior decorated hole in the wall. Greeted at the door by multiple people. Served our drinks and waited on very quickly. It is close to closing and not packed, so I'd hope for that. But it's never guaranteed. Everybody was very nice. I started typing this review after we put in our order, and we just got the order. Fast. Ordered tonkatsu ramen with egg, medium heat. Let's see how it tastes... 
Delicious. Broth is nice and thick, slightly fatty--like it should be. Pork melts in your mouth. Noodles--since they're freshly made here, they're springy and delicious. Egg is done perfectly. Everything about it is great. They use garlic chives, and didn't skimp with just green onion. The medium is quite spicy. And my husband and I both love spicy. So for the person who had mild and felt it wasn't spicy, there must be a large jump between mild and medium. But that's normal for most Asian cuisine. Portion is great. 
Rachel and Maru came around multiple times to give us more of our drinks, and make sure we were happy.
Highly recommend this place. First great ramen place outside of Chinatown. And it's near my house!!! Score!!!!

"Why didn't you stop me?" pants Midwest poker bud.

"You said, when it's hot outside, you need to eat hot, spicy food so you sweat and..." I trail off poorly holding back smug laughter.

Ramen KoBo, the newest offshoot of Monta Ramen.  Same great broths, same great noodles, same great toppings.  The  key difference, spicing up your ramen is encouraged.  Oh and noodles are made by machine, on site.  It has no bearing on the quality of the finished product.

Note:  this location is small owing to the walled off "fish bowl" where you can watch ramen being made.  Expect a wait.

Ordering is simple: choose a broth, pick a spice level, add extra toppings (bowls already have a single piece of chashu, seasoned mushrooms, bamboo shoots, and chives).

As with all Monta's, solid broths.  The tonkotsu stands out for their excellent extraction of in your pork flavor balanced with dashi and garlic, finishing with umame notes.  Gelatinous and palate coating.  Seriously, leave this alone.  The miso on the other hand is perfect for spicing up.  All broths contain MSG.  

Heat is achieved through chili oil and ground chilies.  The spice, even at fire, doesn't drown but compliments the flavor of the broth by adding a chili sweetness and aroma.  Thai food lovers, fire = level three of five.
 
As already mentioned, solid noodles, cooked toothsome (unless you specify otherwise).  Tender and flavorful chashu with minimal fat.

Though pricier than Monta, a basic bowl is $9, with added chashu and nitamago (soft boiled seasoned egg), $13.  Still a good value.

Ate here with the fam after Wet n' Wild since my kids and hubby are always down for noodles. We ate the Tonkotsu Ramen with less salt and medium spiciness. (They have 5 levels - non-spicy, mild, medium, hot and fire). We are so used to Ramen houses being so salty, I specifically requested less salt and was happy to find they accommodated! 

The broth was creamy, but not too thick and was delish. I ordered one non spicy for the kids and they shared a bowl (being 5 and 8) and it was perfect.

The noodles are made fresh in house and that was the next best part. They were chewy and had great texture.

Will definitely be back. Hubby has already gone back with his mountain biking buddies and they enjoyed as well!

I have been a avid ramen-consumer around town and I love the old Monta (before the taste starting to change in recent years) and knew I had to try this place out. 

The menu is pretty similar to Monta except for optional levels of spiciness, 1 piece of pork Chasu instead of 2 but we get ground pork as the other protein instead, comes with bean sprouts, and a higher price tag. 

I went there the second day it opened and ordered my go-to ramen, the Tonkatsu Ramen, original level of spiciness, and I added an egg with an additional charge. The ramen turned out bland so I was disappointed and the egg was just like a tasteless hard-boiled egg. The soup base had pieces of the Tonkatsu oil-like ingredients floating around --- it looked it they did not boiled the broth enough for the ingredients to blend in. 

However, I gave this place another try the week after. I ordered a Shoyu Ramen with no options added as well as the Kimchi Fried Rice. The Kimchi Fried Rice is just as good as the one in Monta and the Shoyo Ramen was delicious! I don't know if it's because they heard feedback from customers about the broth being too bland and fixed it or it's simply because it's a different ramen but it was very well done. 

This is not the end of the review --- the third week, I did try the Miso Ramen and thought it didn't taste bland but it wasn't groundbreaking neither. I would go to this place just for the Shoyo Ramen and the fried rice.

I give this place its' props because when you order the spicy ramen, it is ACTUALLY spicy, unlike many other places I've been. I appreciate that the noodles are perfectly cooked with the perfect amount of bite to them. The broth has depth in flavor and overall, quite tasty. 

I also had the pork belly bowl here which had a nice bbq/grill flavor to it, being nicely savory without being overly salty. The green onion in the bowl also adds some nice flavor to the dish.

The wait around 11:30am on a Sunday was not too bad- about 15 minutes. I would come back, but definitely need to try other ramen spots first!

One of my favorite ramen spots in las vegas!  I can always count on this place for my ramen fix. I really like that their ramen is made in house and cooked perfectly to a right biting texture. They recently added tsukemen ramen which i got to try and it was delicious. the soup base was flavorful and not too salty.  Their miso broth (pork and Chicken) for their standard ramen is also very tasty and that is what i usually get here and i would add corn to it. The service here is great and fast. I will for sure be back here whenever I am craving ramen.

This spot seats you quickly and has an intimate dining setup. Tables are close and the atmosphere is comfortable. Man oh man, I love the ramen here. It's the best I've tasted so far in this city! It's fresh and the spice level is great! I love the broth as well. Cheap price for good quality food. If you're in the Southwest, check this ramen spot out!

As a fan of Monta Chaya in Chinatown and Manta Ramen in Henderson, I was stoked when they announced another noodle house from the same company in the southwest. I'm happy to say they didn't disappoint! The layout is very similar to the other locations, though their menu is slightly different. the ramen was quite delicious and the noodles are made in house. I got the mild Tonkotsu ramen with extra noodles and a pork belly side bowl. All was wonderful! I'll be going back again very soon!

Food is above average.  What I do not understand is why they can't substitute pork for chicken without charging you???  I feel like I am being double charged every time.  They need to correct this or have a signature bowl already with chicken.  I will be back when they change this....

One of the best ramen houses in town. In my opinion the best in the monta chain of restaurants. I frequently go to several excellent ramen places in town but kobo sets itself apart with there house made noodles and various levels of heat. Not the only ramen place I go to but one of the best.

In case you were wondering, MILD isn't supposed to mean burn your mouth completely off, flaming hot. But here that's exactly what it means. If you normally order anything under a spice level 3-4, DO NOT get the mild spice level. Ruined my meal, couldn't eat it :(

I have been here 3 times. Food is delicious. The broth very flavorful and noodles fresh. Small dining room with a few tables and bar seating. There's always a little bit of a wait. The food and service is fast so you don't have to wait long. I would say it's comparable to Monta Ramen and Jinya. Love that it's on the Southwest side of town and fairly close to my house. I will definitely be back.

Had the Shoyu ramen with Nitamago! The ramen here is amazing and tasted great. All noodles are made in house and it's the perfect amount of food to satisfy you! They add ground beef and roasted garlic in the broth which makes it taste just that much better than local competitors! A bunch of my friends are coming into town this Friday for EDC and it looks like we found a great lunch and dinner spot to hit up! Thanks Kobo!

One of my go to places for ramen.  Their broths are a nice blend of flavors without being overly salty - feel like they really play up the garlic and even have additional garlic you can add as a condiment. Watch your spice level - their mild is probably closer to medium at other place, but I feel you need at least a little spice to really enjoy it.  Noodle to soup ratio is perfect in my opinion though I wish that nitamago wasn't extra.  My ramen just isn't complete without the egg.
Nice simple selection of other rice dishes, but ramen is really the Star here.
Another highlight here is their recent addition of dipping noodles - Tsukemen.  Hot soup broth served as a dipping sauce for the cold noodles.  Give it a try for something different esp when the temperatures are rising outside.

When I feel the urge to slurp on hot, delicious ramen noodles this is my go-to! The soup itself is amazing and the add-ons that come free include: chashu pork, garlic, black mushrooms, chives, fresh chives, bamboo shoots, and red pepper.  The noodle is a perfect mix of chewy and soft, leaving your taste buds in heaven.  Here's a tip, if you're sensitive to spice start with mild and work your way up to a different spice level.  Sometimes their medium is a bit too much.  Also, add some spinach for a fresh greens twist.  One last tidbit, free of charge they will let you swap ground pork and chashu for chicken! You can thank me later!

Hands down one of my favorite ramen places in Las Vegas despite the fact that it is a bit of a drive for me. The customer service here has been consistently great the three times that I have eaten here. It is a smaller restaurant so there usually is a wait; however, we have never waited more than fifteen minutes (each time has been a party of three). 

There are five levels of spices: original, mild, medium, hot, and fire. I'm a bit of a wimp when it comes to spices so medium was too hot for me the first time; however, mild has always been just right. 

I don't eat red meat so it is always a struggle finding a ramen place that offers poultry or vegetable based broth; however, Ramen KoBo offers both! In addition, I like to add the extra topping of ground chicken with nori (roasted seaweed) with a seasoned egg.

Customer Service: 5/5
Environment: 5/5
Food: 5/5

Definitely a great place if you're craving ramen and don't feel the desire to drive out to Spring Mountain!

I live in this area and I would say this is the go to ramen joint for my husband and I. It's the closest and also the cheapest. It's fairly small with about 4-5 tables and a bar that can seat about 8. Therefore if you have a party of 5+ then the wait may be longer. Usually I wait for about 10 minutes for a party of two.

The miso broth is great! And I like how they have the option of how spicy you can make your ramen. The mild to medium is how I enjoy mine while my husband goes for the spicy. One thing I thought odd was that the egg was an additional topping. All the other ramen place I've gone to had it in their ramen naturally and this place will add an additional 1.50$. However since this is the cheapest place I can't complain too much.

Service is good and friendly and my water is never empty. Probably because it's such a small place.

I had came here on Friday evening with my friends with a short wait. Service was nice, but the ramen I ordered tasted mediocre to me.  I ordered a mild tonkotsu ramen. The broth was too bland and filled with the chili oil.  I prefer thin noodles and was disappointed to find out that it came in the wavy type noodle only.  This place has about 4-6 tables and bar seating.  I don't think I would come back again, favorites are still Monta and Ramen Sora, especially for the prices too! If I do have to eat at a ramen place nearby, I'd rather go to Ohjah Noodle House that is literally down the street.
Fast review here.  Small place. Perfect ramen and service.  Get at least the medium heat. Chashu is spectacular. Kim chee excellent. Nothing to complain about here...
Really good veggie ramen. Noodles were super chewy and delicious. Come here if you're vegetarian/vegan!

Same owners as Monta that offers more of a spicy kick to ramen.

I had the Tonkotsu Ramen medium and it was tame. Noodles felt fresh as well as all the ingredients. Chashu for some reason is a lot better at Monta but the noodles at KoBo are slightly better....wierd how that is.

Ordered the kimchi fried rice and that shit tastes as good as Monta's.

Dope spot and a good addition to Southwest Vegas...

Being a Monta ramen maven, I had to check out the newest offering from what's a supposedly related ramen stop.  

The place is newer and more modern looking than what I'm used to at Monta and there was even a noodle flattening and cutting machine in operation.  Kinda cool!  Like a field eating trip all in one!  

In taking to the waiter, the place is a totally different ramen style than Monta.  Not sure why he was emphasizing it is so different but it was tasty.  Had the "standard" and "mild" tonkotsu pork broth.  Really rich flavor but there is a difference between the standard and "mild-medium-hot-fiery".  For one, the taste is not just spicier but the flavor is different too.  Also the broth is a red color not the dark eggshell color.  

I liked them both and the fried rice is the same goodness.  Kind of a lot of starch for one sitting but hard to pick which bite to take next!

The other thing that was pretty cool was their electronic menu at the front counter.  Cool gadget and would be cooler if you could place your orders that way too.  Mostly locals here and prices were reasonable.

And lastly, in the dead heat of summer, this place dies have waiting room seats for six and ample room for another four comfortably near the noodle factory room window area :)

It's worth checking out for something new and different!

Pros:
Place was ok. 
The soups are consistent. 

Cons:
-The staff always look so frazzled.
-Very tight
-There's always a line because the restaurant can only accommodate no more than 20 people inside at a time (6 on countertop, 14 in dining floor).
-Menu is limited to mostly PORK.
-Because staff works hard to turn table around fast, the tables are often grossly sticky.
-If you happen to be seated towards the back, you can smell the bathroom.

The place is decent but I wouldn't hold my breath just to get a table. I prefer to go to Ohjah noodle house just a block away.

My ramen spot in southwest. If I can't go to my regular (ramen tatsu) then I go here for a fix. Kinda want more options on side dishes.
Interior and ambiance was good, just a bit tight. I usually eat at the bar so can't complain.
Most of the time I just feel rushed, not by the servers but because I know there's like 20 people waiting outside.
You guys just really need to expand soon
Good food. Only problem is this place is soooo small and parking is limited. The wait is a while and the waiting space gets crowded that people have to go outside and wait.

Calling all ramen fans! This is the place you all need to be. If your looking for a ramen house that is 100% #flavortown with that authentic felling as if your in Japan come on down  I will not lie to you all my lady and could not stay away, we had ramen 4 days in a row. The staff is friendly the service is spot on. Most importantly everything is clean and open to see you can watch the cooks prepare your food!.  ...

P.S if your still not sold on this establishment they make their noodles from scratch you can watch them as it's being made.

I went there around the dinner time, they get us seat as soon as my group arrived. The girl who serve us are really helpful and nice. We got drink right away as soon as we got seated. She recommended the Tonkotsu ramen which is so good, i like the broth and the noodle made perfect. 

The server refilled my water real quick and also our table have a little kid and she is really patient with our demand. As my experience i tip real good on this girl Rachel I definitely gonna come back. This is one of my best experience for the ramen place and they were in a busy  time still gave out a excellent service. 

Food quality is good!!!
Service is excellent
The favor of the both is amazing. You can have it as spicy as you want. Everything is delicious. Fresh noodle made right on the spot.  Noodle cook perfectly.

I am so happy a ramen placed open close to my house, and that it is from the Monta name we know and love. Kobo is different from Monta on Spring Mountain or  Eastern. This location has you choose your level of spiciness from original, to fire. It does not have the option to choose thin or thick noodles like the Spring Mountain location which is fine. They add ground beef, green onion, and a clove of garlic in their soups which the other locations do not do, I think it is a nice touch. The only reason I did not give 5 stars is due to the broth, it doesn't have as much flavor as their other locations, and there is fatty grease floating in it like the other reviewer said. I went twice since they opened first time I got the Miso ramen original, and the second time I got the Shoyu ramen mild. The shoyu ramen had a little more flavor then the miso and I think it was due to the spicy flavoring they use. I will be back and be a frequent customer. Server Ryan was very nice and introduced himself and was very welcoming, great service.
Fast service and delicious ramen! I ate at this place 3 times in one week!! That's how much I love it here!

BEST RAMEN PLACE I HAVE BEEN TO! I really have no complaints about this place and on top of that, they have chicken here so I am not stuck with pork (I don't eat pork). They have levels of spice to their broth starting from no spicy to FIRE. I stick with the "medium" level and that is already pretty spicy to me. From hearing other people order and hearing my friends order, a lot of people get "mild" spice so I would start with that level first. Their broth is so tasty and their noodles are good as well. They actually hand make their noodles so maybe that plays a role as to why it's so good haha. Their service is also good, the waiters are always so nice and on top of that it's quick. It's also not too expensive, it's probably around the same price as other ramen places so if you want good quality ramen, please try this place!

Ramen close to Summerlin, yay!  This is basically Monta with an option for spice.  It's been awhile since I've been to Monta, but the noodles here are fresh made and are definitely al dente when they arrive.  The noodles remind me of a compromise between the thin and wavy noodles at Monta.  Broth is similar to Monta tonkatsu broth and very thick and rich.  The pork seems the same, extremely fatty and tender.  The unfortunate part is this place is just as tiny as the Chinatown Monta =(  I think they should expand, so the customers don't have to wait forever for a table on cold wintery nights =)

Too bad this place is so far from where I live, or I would probably come here daily. I ordered a small fried rice and a bowl of tonkatsu ramen with boiled egg and spinach. Everything was to the perfection level. I've been to Jinya, Monta and Sora, which are the 3 popular places for ramen, none of them was this good. I finished everything including the broth, noodles and toppings. And on top of that I finished the fried rice as well. I'm so glad I made the decision to drive 25 miles to try this place out. So worth it!
Love this place! It's cool that you can see the ramen being made. Very similar to Monta. Never disappoints. Service was quick and they were very kind.

There's this plethora of happiness inside of me knowing that such a solid ramen shop is (somewhat) close to me. Well at least, closer than all the ones at Spring Mountain. 

Here lies Ramen KoBo, sister to Monta Ramen, and a small, petite, homemade ramen noodle shop. As others have already mentioned, their noodles are always made in fresh batches, so you don't have to worry about that funky, stiff chewiness you get at some ramen places when you know they don't serve their ingredients fresh. 

The ramen itself is solid. I personally like my miso with a lot of sodium, as it's already unhealthful in the first place. I think if that's what you are looking for, a heavy broth similar to that of Ramen Sora, then you will find that here. One thing in particular that I found unique was that they added ground pork to the ramen bowl. Never seen that before, but that's just me. 

I do believe that the toppings are more on the overpriced side. Every topping is a dollar or more, and I'm used to seeing it and 75 cents or less. I'd also be much more pleased with my time here if they had a larger appetizer menu to choose from. I usually like to start off with some takoyaki or gyoza, and it was a shame to see that they didn't have either of the two. Although, I did like their kimchi fried rice; it was very flavorful in comparison to what I get sometimes at Monta. 

I know that seating is very limited at this location. I'll be bold to suggest that seating should be even more limited. When you walk inside, you know that of course, the establishment is very small itself. However, it doesn't mean that one should cram as many tables inside as one possibly can. I would've enjoyed my meal much more, without having to hear every single word of the conversation next to me, and feeling as if the couples in my vicinity were breathing right beside my neck. I had to move to the bar area in order to feel relaxed once again. 

Albeit this place has its downsides, the ramen itself, I feel, is a good enough reason to come back here, especially when I'm too lazy to drive all the way to Chinatown.

VISUAL AESTHETIC: 4/5
Location can be crucial for restaurants and in this case, Ramen KoBo is tucked away. Fortunately, It is well seen but the road to enter the shopping center it is located in, is in all honesty, awful due to the proximity being so close to the freeway; cars are running fast and the roads are large and difficult to cross.

The interior is very modern with wooden paneling and matching tables and chairs. The lights are chain hung and include a line of studio bulbs which keep the venue well lit but with a warm tone. The bar area can seat quite a few patrons and is spacious despite the small size of the restaurant itself. It's very pleasing to the eye, with the black framing very clean. The decor is classic to that of most Japanese restaurants, with banners hung above the bar area. 

FOOD: 4.8/5
The noodles here are fresh made, with a large glass window to see the process. There is a machine that essentially flattens the dough and slices it up into portions. Because of this, the noodles are chewy and have a great buoyant texture. 

The way the menu is situated makes it very easy to read and pick the type of broth you would like, how spicy, and any extra toppings that you would want with your ramen which includes adding a portion of noodles. 

I ordered the shoyu (chicken broth) which tends to be hotter. In the case of soup, it keeps the ramen at a nice temperature without cooking through the vegetables. The ramen comes with bamboo shoots, chaysu pork, ground meat, chili slices, and other typical vegetable ingredients. They were all fresh and still contained a light crunch which was pleasant. I also added a soft boiled egg. The extra toppings can cost anywhere from .50 to 2.50. 

I also ordered the chaise fried rice. Ramen KoBo generally has some of the best made chaysu I have come across in Las Vegas, very tender and not try at all. The marinade is delicious but not overpowering that it would ruin the quality taste of meat. The fried rice's presentation was a bit scattered, but tasted good with the chopped ingredients still intact enough to have a variety of texture with the rice.

SERVICE: 5/5
The service was excellent, with the waiters and waitresses attentive to our table. I overheard the servers actually helping out certain individuals when menu items were questioned as well. Overall, everyone was friendly, well adjusted to their surroundings in the case that the restaurant is small and can be hard to maneuver around in, and attentive to the customers.

OVERALL EXPERIENCE: 4.9/5
Honestly, I have been to this location before and was disappointed in how salty the broth was. However today the taste was perfect, not too salty or bland and I was very pleased with the overall taste, service, and of course, the cute Halloween decorations. Ramen restaurants have become abundant in Las Vegas, and with that, competitive advantage is important. This location is supposed to be a sister of Monta, and I was not fond of that location's ramen. However, KoBo has impressed me with today's service. I will definitely be back soon.

I give them 5 stars they are excellent the broth was tasty the portion perfect the add ins delicious and the service excellent.
